entries.name: Markdown command directives
entries.description: `config/markdown.ts` parses directives `@file` And `!` shell inserts into Markdown commands, allowing templates to reference files and run commands on execution.

entries.name: Agent registry hoisting
entries.description: `packages/opencode/src/agent/agent.ts` seeds the built-in general/build/plan agents, merges user-defined markdown definitions, normalises tool availability and permission overlays via `mergeAgentPermissions`, and exposes async `get`/`list` helpers backed by `Instance.state`, keeping all CLI flows on a consistent agent catalog. The register is implemented by commands `cli-run` And `cli-agent-create`.

entries.name: Async context helper
entries.description: `Context.create` (`packages/opencode/src/util/context.ts`) wraps `AsyncLocalStorage`, throwing explicit errors when accessed outside a scope, which keeps per-request metadata (like current instance) safe across async boundaries.

entries.name: Credential vault in data
entries.description: `packages/opencode/src/auth/index.ts` persists provider credentials in `Global.Path.data/auth.json`, exposes discriminated unions for oauth/api/wellknown entries and rewrites the file with `chmod 600`, giving the auth CLI flows a secure per-user secret store. Data is being read `cli-auth-login` and providers from `integrations-provider-loader`.

entries.name: Bun subprocess orchestrator
entries.description: `BunProc` in `packages/opencode/src/bun/index.ts` wraps Bun.spawn with logging, applies the `BUN_BE_BUN` environment flag and exposes `install` that caches npm modules under `Global.Path.cache`, throwing typed errors when downloads fail so CLI commands can bootstrap Node packages consistently.

entries.name: Hierarchical config cascade
entries.description: `packages/opencode/src/config/config.ts` merges the global default config with project `.opencode` overrides, flag-provided JSON payloads and plugin manifests; it installs plugin dependencies when running remote, hydrates Markdown commands/agents and migrates legacy keybind fields so all services reuse a single cached configuration snapshot. These services call `cli-serve`, `cli-tui` and server routes.

entries.name: Instance-scoped event bus
entries.description: `Bus` (`packages/opencode/src/bus/index.ts`) registers Zod-typed events, keeps subscriptions inside `Instance.state` and broadcasts to specific and wildcard listeners so background services share telemetry without leaking outside the current opencode workspace. These services call `cli-serve`, `cli-tui` and server routes.

entries.name: Git-aware file service
entries.description: `File` (`packages/opencode/src/file/index.ts`) tracks git status, composes diffs when reading, lists directories with ignore support and performs fuzzy search using ripgrep caches, giving tools a unified filesystem API. These services call `cli-serve`, `cli-tui` and server routes.

entries.name: Environment feature toggles
entries.description: `Flag` (`packages/opencode/src/flag/flag.ts`) normalises boolean env vars for auto-share, auto-update, watcher experiments and default plugin control so runtime behaviour can be tuned without code changes.

entries.name: FZF downloader and cache
entries.description: `Fzf.filepath()` (`packages/opencode/src/file/fzf.ts`) lazily downloads platform-specific archives, extracts binaries into `Global.Path.bin` and reuses system installations when available, ensuring fuzzy find commands work across OSes.

entries.name: Global data directories bootstrap
entries.description: `packages/opencode/src/global/index.ts` derives XDG data/cache/config/state roots for opencode, creates `bin`/`log` folders up front and wipes the cache when the stored version marker changes, so every CLI component shares a consistent home even after upgrades.

entries.name: Monotonic identifier factory
entries.description: `Identifier` (`packages/opencode/src/id/id.ts`) creates ascending or descending base62 IDs with type prefixes, keeping per-millisecond counters so session, message and permission records remain sortable across restarts.

entries.name: Bootstrap pipeline for runtimes
entries.description: `InstanceBootstrap` (`packages/opencode/src/project/bootstrap.ts`) initializes plugins, share sync, formatter hooks, LSP, snapshots and file watchers unless the experimental disable flag is set, guaranteeing every CLI session wires the same background services after `Instance.provide`.

entries.name: Structured logging core
entries.description: `Log.create` (`packages/opencode/src/util/log.ts`) centralises log level filtering, rotates files under `Global.Path.log`, rewrites stderr and offers scoped timers so background services emit consistent telemetry.

entries.name: Interactive permission broker
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/permission/index.ts` keeps pending permission prompts in an `Instance.state` cache, emits `permission.ask` events through the plugin bus and records "always" approvals so later tool calls auto-resolve, enforcing consistent user consent for agent tool access.

entries.name: Plugin bootstrap pipeline
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/plugin/index.ts` boots a local opencode SDK client, resolves configured plugins (installing npm packages when necessary) and initialises their hooks while subscribing the bus to forward events, so both default and user plugins share the same lifecycle.

entries.name: Project discovery and persistence
entries.description: `Project.fromDirectory` (`packages/opencode/src/project/project.ts`) walks up for `.git`, falls back to a global project when absent and persists project IDs plus timestamps via `Storage`, so other services can link sessions to a stable workspace identifier.

entries.name: Ripgrep bootstrap and helpers
entries.description: `Ripgrep` (`packages/opencode/src/file/ripgrep.ts`) fetches release archives per CPU/OS, exposes streaming file walkers and tree builders and wraps JSON search output, powering glob, grep and tree tooling without requiring system installs.

entries.name: Storage migrations & locking
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/storage/storage.ts` lazily initialises the per-user storage root, runs migrations that rebucket legacy session archives by Git project id, wraps reads/writes with file locks and normalises ENOENT errors into a typed `NotFoundError`, keeping session data durable across upgrades.

entries.name: Parcel watcher integration
entries.description: `FileWatcher` (`packages/opencode/src/file/watcher.ts`) loads the platform-specific `@parcel/watcher` native binding, applies config ignore globs and publishes `file.watcher.updated` bus events, enabling experimental live reload flows.

entries.name: File ignore heuristics
entries.description: `file/ignore.ts` defines folder/mask lists and auxiliary globs, filtering temporary and binary artifacts when traversing files so that the File API returns only relevant paths.

entries.name: Bun Turbo monorepo layout
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/package.json` defines a private bun monorepository with workspace patterns for `packages/*`, console and SDK packages, scripts `dev`/`typecheck` via Turbo, common pinned catalogs and dependency patches, which fixes a single runtime and tools for all packages. Simplifies workspace configuration for `cli-run` And `automation-release-script`, providing a single root for assembly.

entries.name: Models.dev macro loader
entries.description: `provider/models-macro.ts` pulls up `https://models.dev/api.json` and returns raw JSON so that configuration generation can embed the current list of models without a local cache. Data picks up `cli-models`, `cli-models-provider` And `automation-release-script`. Data use `cli-models`, `cli-models-provider` And `automation-release-script`. Tagged `model-catalog` and supplies the list for CLI/TUI.

entries.name: SST Cloudflare-first stack
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/sst.config.ts` announces an opencode application with a base in Cloudflare, selects `retain` for production-stage, connects Stripe and Planetscale providers and loads modules upon startup `infra/app|console|desktop`, securing a single configuration of stages and providers.

entries.name: Cloudflare DurableObject sync API
entries.description: `infra/app.ts` registers Cloudflare Worker `Api` with durable object namespace `SyncServer`, A `packages/function/src/api.ts` implements `SyncServer` for websocket session synchronization, publishing to R2 and REST endpoints `share_*`, `exchange_github_app_token` for GitHub App authorization, enabling the exchange of data and tokens for clients and GitHub Actions.

entries.name: Stage-based Cloudflare domains
entries.description: `infra/stage.ts` compares `$app.stage` with domains `opencode.ai`, registered by Cloudflare `RegionalHostname` for zone `430ba34c138cfb5360826c4909f99be8` and thereby prepares the DNS database that is used `sst-cloudflare-home` And `sync-server-api` when releasing APIs and docs of subdomains.

entries.name: API worker logpush
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/infra/app.ts` provisions the Cloudflare Worker that fronts the sync API, forces logpush, binds secrets and adds the `SYNC_SERVER` durable object namespace via the `transform.worker` hook, giving runtime traffic centralised logging.

entries.name: R2 bucket binding
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/infra/app.ts` creates an `sst.cloudflare.Bucket` and links it to the API worker, ensuring uploads like session shares land in a managed R2 bucket reachable from the Durable Object.

entries.name: Docs Astro deployment
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/infra/app.ts` defines an `sst.cloudflare.x.Astro` site for docs.opencode, wiring stage-specific environment variables like `VITE_API_URL` to the deployed worker so documentation and API hostnames stay in sync.

entries.name: Honeycomb log processor
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/console/function/src/log-processor.ts` listens to Cloudflare trace tails, extracts metrics from completion routes and forwards them with Honeycomb headers, giving the Zen API external observability. The flow pipe connects to the worker `infra-api-worker` and metrics from `automation-stats`.

entries.name: Desktop static site deployment
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/infra/desktop.ts` deploys Cloudflare StaticSite `desktop.opencode.ai`, collecting `packages/desktop` through `bun turbo build` and publishing `dist`, so the desktop instructions are updated along with the SST stage configuration.

entries.name: SyncServer R2 fanout
entries.description: Method `publish` from `packages/function/src/api.ts` stores session messages in R2 under keys `share/<session/...>.json`, supports in-memory DO cache and broadcasts updates to all websockets, making realtime share links without a separate broker.

entries.name: Share secret lifecycle
entries.description: `SyncServer.share` generates a UUID secret, caches it in durable storage along with `sessionID` and reuses for repeated calls, and `/share_create` returns public URL `https://<web>/s/<short>` - this links the CLI and public distribution without storing secrets outside of Cloudflare.

entries.name: Share websocket upgrade
entries.description: Endpoint `/share_poll` checks the title `Upgrade`, retrieves durable stub by short identifier and delegates `fetch` pairs of sockets, and `SyncServer.fetch` reproduces history at the input `session/*` to the connected WebSocket - this is how the console receives historical messages immediately after connecting.

entries.name: GitHub PAT exchange guard
entries.description: `/exchange_github_app_token_with_pat` V `api.ts` requires Bearer PAT, via Octokit checks that the user has `write`/`maintain`/`admin` rights to the repository, and only after that issues an installation token - thereby local runs `opencode github run` do not bypass GitHub ACL.

entries.name: Share data snapshot
entries.description: Request `/share_data` iterates durable storage, groups `session/info`, `session/message` And `session/part` in JSON, restoring messages and their parts before sending - public share pages use this API to instantly download history.

entries.name: Console log tail binding
entries.description: IN `infra/console.ts` SolidStart application receives `transform.server.worker.placement` and dynamic `tailConsumers`, connecting Honeycomb `LogProcessor` only at production/frank stages, which removes combat logs `/zen` into a separate worker without affecting the dev environment.

entries.name: Share deletion endpoints
entries.description: `/share_delete` V `packages/function/src/api.ts` checks the secret via `SyncServer.assertSecret`, causes `clear()` to delete all R2 session objects and storage records, and `/share_delete_admin` strictly clears the default DO id for support - this ensures emergency shutdown of public share links.

entries.name: share_sync payload guard
entries.description: Endpoint `/share_sync` accepts sessionID, secret, key and content, pulls `SyncServer.assertSecret` And `publish`to synchronize messages in R2 and send them to subscribers; an incorrect secret instantly stops data recording.

entries.name: GitHub OIDC token exchange
entries.description: `/exchange_github_app_token` V `api.ts` downloads GitHub Actions JWKS, checks the OIDC token for audience `opencode-github-action`, parses `repo:owner/name` and only then receives the installation token via `@octokit/auth-app`, excluding substitution of actions.

entries.name: Yargs CLI entrypoint
entries.description: `packages/opencode/src/index.ts` collects CLI `opencode` on yargs, connects attach/run/generate/debug/github/mcp and other commands, and middleware initializes `Log` with USER_AGENT setting, puts down `OPENCODE=1` and logs the arguments. Block `fail` and exception handlers pass errors through `NamedError`/`FormatError` And `UI.error`, completing `AbortController`, so each run gets consistent logging and hints. Team registers `cli-bootstrap`, `cli-serve` And `cli-tui`, so TUI and headless modes receive a single environment. The recorder connects `cli-tui`, `cli-serve`, `cli-generate` and automation scripts. Designed for chain `terminal-bridge`, combining bootstrap and TUI.

entries.name: Global path bootstrap
entries.description: `global/index.ts` creates XDG directories `data/bin/log/cache/state` and writes the cache version, removing outdated files when changed `CACHE_VERSION`. Thanks to this, CLI and TUI binaries, logs and caches live in a consistent user directory. Path used `cli-serve` And `terminal-ui` for the binary cache and connects from `automation-release-script` when preparing releases.

entries.name: Config-backed command registry
entries.description: `command/index.ts` reads `Config.command` to zod diagram `Command.Info`, caches the dictionary in `Instance.state` and provides `Command.get/list`. Markdown macros and plugins use it to raise an agent, model and template without their own parser. Register in use `cli-tui`, markdown commands and `tool-guide-*` descriptions for downloading CLI workflows. The directory is marked `workflow-config`, sharing configuration with automation.

entries.name: models.dev cache & refresh
entries.description: `provider/models.ts` caches the response `https://models.dev/api.json` V `${Global.Path.cache}/models.json`, validates the data through zod and substitutes a macro if the file is missing. `refresh()` starts with a timer every hour and uses `Installation.USER_AGENT`so that the CLI and server see the current providers and model limits. Cash is shared `cli-run`, `cli-tui` and GitHub workflows so that runtime and TUI serve the same models. The provider uses `model-catalog` (macro + automation release).

entries.name: stderr UI primitives
entries.description: `cli/ui.ts` defines a palette of ANSI styles, ASCII logo, secure `print/println` And `input` on top `readline`, as well as a marker `CancelledError`. These primitives use all commands to provide a consistent user experience and error handling. These primitives render both the CLI and `cli-tui`, and also write errors in `server-core` streams.

entries.name: Config-aware error formatter
entries.description: `cli/error.ts` translates `MCP.Failed` and parsing errors `Config` (invalid/json/directory) into human-readable messages listing problems and suppresses `UI.CancelledError`. Thanks to this, top-level commands show clear output instead of a raw stack trace. The formatter is called `cli-serve` and TUI bridge, as well as wrap-in `automation-release-script` for human readable logs.

entries.name: Installation channel manager
entries.description: `installation/index.ts` defines the installation method `process.execPath`, checks global npm/yarn/pnpm/bun/brew via Bun `$` and publishes the event `installation.updated` after `upgrade`. The module logs stdout/stderr, generates `Installation.USER_AGENT` and throws it away `UpgradeFailedError`so that the CLI can select the correct update script. The manager supplies the version and USER_AGENT for `cli-serve` And `terminal-ui` clients and also runs from `automation-release-script` upon publication. Channels are called `cli-upgrade-channel`, `automation-release-script` And `cli-tui` updates. Participates in `terminal-bridge`, preparing binaries for TUI/CLI.

entries.name: IDE detection & installer
entries.description: `ide/index.ts` defines IDE by `TERM_PROGRAM`/`GIT_ASKPASS`, launches `windsurf|code|cursor --install-extension sst-dev.opencode` via Bun `spawn` and logs stdout/stderr. Errors are normalized in `InstallFailedError`/`AlreadyInstalledError`, and the event `ide.installed` published via Bus. Helper is called `cli-tui` And `terminal-ui` to install IDE extensions next to the terminal client. Used onboarding `cli-tui`, `cli-installation-management` And `console-admin` IDE hints. Associated with tag `terminal-bridge`, providing IDE integration for TUI.

entries.name: Docs agent prompt
entries.description: `.opencode/agent/docs.md` sets a brief: short sections, imperative headings without repeating the topic, example `/packages/web/...`, formatting requirements and prefix `docs:` for commits. Markdown is loading `AgentRegistry`, to `opencode docs` issued agreed texts. The script is connected as a markdown command in `cli-tui` and writes down tips for `session.prompt`.

entries.name: Git committer subagent
entries.description: `.opencode/agent/git-committer.md` describes the subagent for git push: short WHY commits, no change enumeration and mode `subagent`. `AgentRegistry` connects this brief when the CLI automates commits. The command is used from `cli-tui` and automation, preparing prompts for `session` stories.

entries.name: Commit command template
entries.description: `.opencode/command/commit.md` generates a macro `commit and push` with mandatory prefixes (`docs:`, `core:`, etc.) and the requirement to explain the reason for the changes. The command loader adds the template to the directory, making git scripting easier. The template is called from `cli-tui` And `tool-guide-task`, securing the commit workflow. The template is integrated into `tool-guide-task`, `cli-generate` and TUI commit dialog. Tagged `cli-templates` along with a task guide.

entries.name: Spellcheck command template
entries.description: `.opencode/command/spellcheck.md` instructs to collect uncommitted changes `.md/.mdx`, extract strings and check spelling, adding a ready-made QA step to the CLI directory. Used by TUI dialogs (`tui-dialog`), helping the terminal client check texts. Used `tool-guide-spellcheck`, `cli-generate` and TUI editor. Included in the set `cli-templates`, linking CLI/TUI and tool guides.

entries.name: Hello command template
entries.description: `.opencode/command/hello.md` demonstrates macro syntax: prints a greeting with `$ARGUMENTS`, performs built-in `!ls` and refers to `@README.md`, serving as an example for custom commands. The demonstration falls into `tool-guide-*` And `cli-tui` onboarding. Added to `cli-templates`, used in tool guides examples.

entries.name: Hono server core
entries.description: `server/server.ts` builds a Hono application with OpenAPI generation, CORS and per-request `Instance.provide`, which runs `InstanceBootstrap` before processing. Routes serve config/project/provider/session/tool/TUI, stream events via SSE and normalize errors `NamedError`/`Storage.NotFoundError`, additionally logging requests and publications `server.connected`. The same service is being raised `cli-serve` And `terminal-ui` bridge for the local TUI, and automations access it during `automation-release-script`. Serves events `session.*` And `share_sync`, combining CLI, TUI and GitHub workflows.

entries.name: Share sync bridge
entries.description: `share/share.ts` subscribes to message/part events bus, buffers pending payloads and sends them to `${Share.URL}/share_sync` with a session secret. It also creates and removes balls (`share_create/share_delete`), providing streaming history replication.

entries.name: Prompt orchestration engine
entries.description: `session/prompt.ts` queues requests, holds `SessionLock`, resolve agent/model via `Agent.get` And `Provider.getModel`, collects system hints and temperatures from plugins, and then streams the answers via `streamText`, enriching them with tools (`resolveTools`) and stone `SessionRevert`.

entries.name: Session lifecycle manager
entries.description: `session/index.ts` creates, forks and updates sessions, putting down versions, auto-share via `Share.create`, events `session.updated/deleted/error` and caching `touch`. It clones the fork history and uses `Installation.VERSION` And `Config.share` for behavior.

entries.name: Session compaction pipeline
entries.description: `session/compaction.ts` monitors context overflow (`isOverflow`), cuts off old tool calls after 40k tokens and runs `streamText` to summarize history. The created message assistant updates usage via `Session.getUsage`, notes `summary` and publishes the event `session.compacted`.

entries.name: Session revert workflow
entries.description: `session/revert.ts` allows you to roll back a reply or part: captures a snapshot via `Snapshot.track`, records diff, deletes future messages and protects operations `SessionLock`. Functions `unrevert` And `cleanup` restore git tree and clear Storage/EventBus upon user confirmation.

entries.name: Git snapshot engine
entries.description: `snapshot/index.ts` initializes private git in `${Global.Path.data}/snapshot/<project>`, tracks the working tree (`track`/`patch`), restores files and builds diffs. It uses Bun `$` And `Instance.worktree`so that SessionRevert and share have a stable base.

entries.name: Session TODO tracker
entries.description: `session/todo.ts` stores a list of tasks in `Storage`, validates the structure via zod and publishes the event `todo.updated`. CLI and TUI synchronize statuses, receiving `Todo.get` for the current session.

entries.name: Session lock manager
entries.description: `session/lock.ts` holds `AbortController` for every session, throws it away `SessionLockedError` upon repeated requests and provides `acquire()`/`abort()`/`assertUnlocked`. Usage `using` automatically releases the lock and logs forced release upon completion `Instance`.

entries.name: Message v1 schema
entries.description: `session/message.ts` describes the Zod-scheme of messages: text, reasoning, tool-invocation with statuses, source-url and file parts, as well as metadata with tokens, snapshot and errors (`OutputLengthError`, `AuthError`). This structure validates old stories and plugin responses.

entries.name: Message v2 schema
entries.description: `session/message-v2.ts` models modern history: snapshot/patch/text/reasoning/tool parts with rich states (`pending|running|completed|error`), file sources and Bus events (`message.part.updated/removed`). Converters `fromV1` and AI helpers form `ModelMessage` for streaming.

entries.name: System prompt resolver
entries.description: `session/system.ts` selects hints for the provider (Anthropic, Gemini, GPT, Qwen), builds an environment with `Ripgrep.tree` and looks for local/global instructions (`AGENTS.md`, `Config.instructions`). These blocks are combined for summarize/title/agent modes.

entries.name: File timestamp guard
entries.description: `file/time.ts` stores file read times in `Instance.state`, logs requests and allows `assert()` check that the file has been read and has not changed (`mtime`) before recording. This forces agents to call the Read tool and prevents user edits from being lost.

entries.name: Worktree discovery & storage
entries.description: `project/project.ts` picks up git worktree, reads the first commit via `git rev-list`, caches `Project.Info` V `Storage` and creates a fallback "global" project in the absence of a VCS, so that all sessions have a stable identifier and path.

entries.name: Instance bootstrap pipeline
entries.description: `project/bootstrap.ts` initializes plugins, shares, formatters, LSPs, snapshots and file watcher before the first command, checking the flag `OPENCODE_EXPERIMENTAL_NO_BOOTSTRAP`so that Instance always has services ready regardless of the environment.

entries.name: Instance scoped context
entries.description: `project/instance.ts` caches `Project.Info` by directory, raises the context through `Context.create` and manages `State` dependencies: `Instance.provide` initializes the project once, and `Instance.dispose` causes deferred `State.dispose`, synchronizing the CLI, server and plugins.

entries.name: Instance state registry
entries.description: `project/state.ts` stores lazy singletons on a key `Instance.directory`: `State.create` re-submits the previously initialized value and binds `dispose`-callbacks, and `State.dispose` Asynchronously releases resources when the session ends.

entries.name: Console OpenAuth worker
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/console/function/src/auth.ts` lifts Cloudflare worker on OpenAuth, includes GitHub and Google providers with stage-dependent email checks, stores states in KV and uses secrets that are allocated in `console-stack`to create Subjects for accounts and workspace subscriptions.

entries.name: Console stack with Planetscale and Stripe
entries.description: `infra/console.ts` sets up Planetscale branches for a stage, issues passwords via secrets, creates linkable `Database`, connects the dev team `bun db studio`, outputs an auth API worker with GitHub/Google secrets and a SolidStart console, linking the Stripe webhook, Honeycomb log processor and mail secrets for the console frontend.

entries.name: Workspace layout shell
entries.description: `packages/console/app/src/routes/workspace.tsx` forms a basic layout: picks up email via `getUserEmail` query, sets a favicon, renders the brand with `WorkspacePicker` And `UserMenu`, creating a wrapper for all workspace routes.

entries.name: Workspace navigation rail
entries.description: `routes/workspace/[id].tsx` builds the left navbar with Solid `A` links to Zen, Keys, Members and the Billing/Settings admin block, hiding administrative items if `querySessionInfo` does not give the admin role.

entries.name: Workspace auth helpers
entries.description: `routes/workspace/common.tsx` defines server `queryIsLoggedIn`, `querySessionInfo`, billing API and `createCheckoutUrl`, wrapping them in `withActor` for each workspace session so that the UI receives a role, beta flags and payment URLs without duplicating logic.

entries.name: Workspace picker modal
entries.description: Component `WorkspacePicker` pulls up the workspace list via server query, renders the drop-down `DropdownItem` list and modal window for creating a workspace by calling `Workspace.create` and redirect to a new page.

entries.name: User menu logout flow
entries.description: `routes/user-menu.tsx` wraps email in `Dropdown`, and the action `logout` through `useAuthSession` clears the current account, resets actor to request locals and redirects to `/zen`, ensuring correct exit from console.

entries.name: Billing control panel
entries.description: `billing-section.tsx` uses `Billing.reload`, `generateSessionUrl` And `createCheckoutUrl`, rendering the UI to enable auto-refills, reload restarts, and display Stripe errors, allowing admins to manage balances from the UI.

entries.name: Monthly limit editor
entries.description: `monthly-limit-section.tsx` shapes `setMonthlyLimit`, numerical limit validation and displays current monthly consumption, allowing admins to set or edit the workspace budget.

entries.name: Payments table & receipts
entries.description: `payment-section.tsx` loads `Billing.payments()`, displays payment history, formats dollar amounts, and calls `Billing.generateReceiptUrl` when you click View, opening the PDF receipt in a new tab.

entries.name: API key management UI
entries.description: `key-section.tsx` implements the creation and deletion of API keys via `Key.create/remove`, displays masked keys, buffers copy, and records last used, helping operators manage Gateway access.

entries.name: Member roster & invites
entries.description: `member-section.tsx` maintains the list of participants through `User.list`, manages invitations/removals, edits role and personal limit using `RoleDropdown` and server actions for a full cycle of team management.

entries.name: Role dropdown component
entries.description: `role-dropdown.tsx` uses common `Dropdown`, tracks local `open` signal and emits `onChange`, highlighting the selected role and showing a description - this component is used by inline editors of team members.

entries.name: Usage history table
entries.description: `usage-section.tsx` loads `Billing.usages()` and outputs a table with date, model, input/output tokens and value, formatting dates using `formatDateForTable`, so that admins can see the cost of calls.

entries.name: Console debug API
entries.description: `packages/console/app/src/routes/debug/index.ts` publishes a GET endpoint that, via `Database.use` counts users `UserTable` and returns JSON - internal diagnostics to check the availability of the Planetscale connection.

entries.name: Dropdown primitive
entries.description: `component/dropdown.tsx` implements managed state control via Solid store, handles clicks outside the element and provides `DropdownItem` for Workspaces/User menu, unifying the console drop-down lists. Used in workspace menu `console-admin` and Zen landing page.

entries.name: Email waitlist form
entries.description: `component/email-signup.tsx` subscribes to EmailOctopus: Solid action `emailSignup` writes the API key from `console-resource`, displays states `useSubmission` and blocks the button during a request for the Zen landing page.

entries.name: Main site landing
entries.description: `routes/index.tsx` generates opencode main page: pulls release/statistics through `github()` query, substitutes install commands with copy-to-clipboard and organizes video/FAQ/Legal sections for CLI marketing. CTA blocks lead to `console-admin` workspace onboarding.

entries.name: Zen marketing page
entries.description: `routes/zen/index.tsx` assembles a Zen landing page: sets caching HTTP headers, uses `Header`/`Footer`, comparison videos and FAQ, substituting solid-meta OG tags and login verification for CTA. Goes to authorization `console-admin` and uses common workspace forms.

entries.name: Modal overlay
entries.description: `component/modal.tsx` Renders a shaded layer on top of content, supports title and overlay clicks to close, used in WorkspacePicker and other confirmation forms. The same component is used `console-admin` forms and onboarding in console-site.

entries.name: Landing GitHub metrics
entries.description: `lib/github.ts` performs server `query`: in parallel, pulls the repository, releases and reads the contributors Link header, returning stars, the release link and the number of contributors for the showcase on the main page. Metrics are displayed on the main and Workspace panels `console-admin` for general branding.

entries.name: SolidStart router shell
entries.description: `app/src/app.tsx` wraps the application in `Router` With `MetaProvider`, sets `<Title>`/`<Meta>` and uses `Suspense` to load routes, providing general layout and SEO tags for the console and marketing pages. Configuration shares layout c `console-admin` And `console-site` routing.

entries.name: Console SolidStart config
entries.description: `app/app.config.ts` includes middleware, allows `allowedHosts`, disables minify for Cloudflare Workers, declares external `cloudflare:workers` and fixes `compatibilityDate`so that the marketing site is correctly assembled in the edge environment. Settings are reused `console-admin` and edge proxy, providing a common Cloudflare profile.

entries.name: Responsive header with auth state
entries.description: `component/header.tsx` pulls up GitHub stars and login status, displays an adaptive navbar (desktop/mobile) with Zen/Login switching, and manages the burger menu through the Solid store. The component shares the menu with `console-admin` and uses a design system.

entries.name: Footer link grid
entries.description: `component/footer.tsx` builds a four-column footer with links to GitHub, Docs, Discord and X, reusing GitHub stars and a consistent style for marketing pages. Footer is connected on pages `console-admin` and in the design system.

entries.name: Collapsible FAQ module
entries.description: `component/faq.tsx` uses Kobalte `Collapsible` for questions and answers: displays plus/minus and control elements, providing an accessible accordion for landing pages. Responses link to workflow `console-admin` and workspace management.

entries.name: Reusable icon set
entries.description: `component/icon.tsx` exports SVG components (logo, copy, receipt, credit card, chevron, OpenAI/Anthropic), unifying iconography for the console and landing pages. The same SVGs are included in `design-system` stand and panels `console-admin`.

entries.name: Dynamic docs social meta
entries.description: `components/Head.astro` overrides Starlight metadata to generate share cards for docs: it base64-encodes page titles for the social-card worker and rewrites OG/Twitter images while keeping the homepage title suffix.

entries.name: Docs header override
entries.description: `components/Header.astro` replaces the default Starlight header on share pages, injecting marketing nav links and social icons while hiding the sidebar links on narrow viewports.

entries.name: Hero vs docs router
entries.description: `components/Hero.astro` swaps the homepage hero to the bespoke `Lander` component while letting inner pages fall back to Starlight's standard hero slots.

entries.name: Homepage CTA layout
entries.description: `components/Lander.astro` renders the install CTA, multi-platform commands, product highlights and screenshot gallery, sourcing social links from config so the marketing homepage stays in Astro.

entries.name: Logo-aware site title
entries.description: `components/SiteTitle.astro` emits the brand logo with dark/light variants from Starlight config and keeps the text title accessible for screen readers, matching marketing navigation requirements.

entries.name: Marketing icon exports
entries.description: `components/icons/index.tsx` exposes the curated SVG icon set with strongly typed Solid components, letting docs pages compose hero cards without importing raw assets.

entries.name: Custom provider icons
entries.description: `components/icons/custom.tsx` defines custom Solid SVGs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini, opencode logomark, Meta, Robot, Brain) used across marketing sections alongside the generic icon set.

entries.name: Astro Cloudflare deployment config
entries.description: `astro.config.mjs` and `config.mjs` set the site base, Cloudflare adapter, social links, sidebar structure and schema generation hook that runs the CLI schema exporter after builds.

entries.name: Agent switcher in LocalProvider
entries.description: `packages/desktop/src/context/local.tsx` builds `agent` store on top `sync.data.agent`, holds selected agent, cycles through `current` arrows and synchronizes the model when changing so that Desktop prompts are always sent with the correct agent.

entries.name: Context attachments registry
entries.description: `LocalProvider` manages `context` list: adds active files and selections with unique keys, synchronizes them with the file tree and allows PromptForm to quickly collect attachments for the prompt.

entries.name: Tabbed editor with drag-and-drop
entries.description: `desktop/src/components/editor-pane.tsx` uses `@thisbeyond/solid-dnd` to drag tabs, `useLocal` to open files and switches the view between raw, unified and split diff.

entries.name: Desktop SDK event bus
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/desktop/src/context/event.tsx` signs `EventProvider` on `sdk.event.subscribe()` and relays the event stream via Solid EventBus so that Desktop instantly receives updates to sessions, files and tools without manual polling.

entries.name: File store Desktop
entries.description: `context/local.tsx` forms `file` store: mirrors the tree `sync.data.node`, loads content via `sdk.file.read`, tracks open tabs and diffs, and also calculates `changes()` from `sync.data.changes`so that the file panel UI and diff viewer have reactive data.

entries.name: File watcher refresh
entries.description: Through `EventProvider` `LocalProvider` catches events `file.watcher.updated` And `message.part.updated`, after which it reloads the contents of the file and rereads the change status (with a timeout) so that the local tabs always reflect the actual Git state of the working tree.

entries.name: Layout manager
entries.description: `LocalProvider` stores panel configurations in localStorage (`layout` block), normalizes size/visibility, provides `ensurePane` And `toggle`so that custom editor, file tree and timeline layouts are restored between sessions.

entries.name: Markdown pipeline Desktop
entries.description: `packages/desktop/src/context/marked.tsx` connects `marked` with plugin `marked-shiki`, lazily loads languages from Shiki and renders markdown into the theme `opencode`so that the UI shows messages and diffs with highlighting just like in the CLI.

entries.name: Model picker with history
entries.description: IN `LocalProvider` (`context/local.tsx`) block `model` collects a list of models from `sync.data.provider`, stores the latest selections in localStorage and restores them on startup, limiting the history to five elements and picking up a fallback if there is no stored value.

entries.name: Prompt composer with context mentions and speech
entries.description: `prompt-form.tsx` leads the state through `createStore`, parses `@`-inserts, synchronizes scrolling, connects `usePromptSpeech` and gives an inline picker of context.

entries.name: Desktop provider composition
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/desktop/src/index.tsx` wires the Theme, Shiki, Marked, SDK, Event, Sync and Local providers around the Solid router, yielding a desktop UI with preconfigured syntax highlighting and sync context.

entries.name: Desktop opencode SDK bootstrap
entries.description: `packages/desktop/src/context/sdk.tsx` initializes the Solid context `SDKProvider`, creating `createOpencodeClient` with address from Vite variables (`VITE_OPENCODE_SERVER_HOST`/`PORT`) and providing a single HTTP client for all desktop components.

entries.name: Kobalte select wrapper
entries.description: `components/select.tsx` wraps `@kobalte/core/select`, groups options, forwards the Solid button as a trigger and draws custom indicators.

entries.name: Fuzzy command palette
entries.description: `components/select-dialog.tsx` uses `fuzzysort`, groups results via Remeda, controls the keyboard and synchronizes selections with the Solid list.

entries.name: Virtualised session picker
entries.description: `components/session-list.tsx` renders sessions via `virtua/solid` VList, highlights the active one, shows share URL and time of last update using Luxon.

entries.name: Timeline renderer for tool traces
entries.description: `components/session-timeline.tsx` flips through parts `Part`s, can expand diff for write/edit, displays Markdown for bash and highlights errors via `sync.sanitize`.

entries.name: Active session helper
entries.description: IN `context/local.tsx` block `session` stores the active Desktop session, calls `sync.session.sync` when selected, it clears the state, ensuring consistent operation of the timeline and prompt forms with real session data.

entries.name: Solid Shiki highlighter
entries.description: `packages/desktop/src/context/shiki.tsx` creates a highlighter with a theme `opencode`, reassigns colors to CSS variables and feeds it through the context so that any component can highlight the code consistently with the brand palette.

entries.name: Desktop static bundle deployment
entries.description: `infra/desktop.ts` displays Cloudflare StaticSite `Desktop` on `desktop.<stage>` with build `bun turbo build` and publication `./dist`, which formalizes the deployment of the desktop client as a static artifact.

entries.name: Web Speech wrapper with commit heuristics
entries.description: `utils/speech.ts` creates `SpeechRecognition`, monitors interim hypotheses, delays commit for 250 ms and writes the final text to `createSignal`.

entries.name: SyncProvider bootstrap
entries.description: `packages/desktop/src/context/sync.tsx` simultaneously loads providers, agents, file trees, statuses and sessions via SDK, stores them in the Solid store and applies binary search for event merges, producing `absolute`/`sanitize` for the UI and hiding the application until it is fully initialized.

entries.name: Desktop sync store
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/desktop/src/context/sync.tsx` initialises a store for providers, agents, sessions and file status, subscribes to opencode bus events and exposes helpers to resync sessions, powering the live desktop dashboard.

entries.name: Desktop theme manager
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/desktop/src/context/theme.tsx` keeps theme and dark-mode state in localStorage, applies `data-theme` attributes and lets users cycle presets with Ctrl+T, giving the desktop app quick theming controls.

entries.name: Desktop code viewer
entries.description: `components/code.tsx` uses Shiki highlighting, diff transformers and selection syncing to display code with scroll/selection state tied to the local store.

entries.name: Desktop file tree
entries.description: `components/file-tree.tsx` renders collapsible directory nodes with drag-and-drop payloads, tooltips and dirty indicators using the local file store.

entries.name: Markdown renderer
entries.description: `components/markdown.tsx` strips redundant wrappers, streams markdown through the shared Marked context and outputs prose-mode HTML for prompts.

entries.name: Resizable pane layout
entries.description: `components/resizeable-pane.tsx` tracks pane meta in the local layout store, converts pixel constraints to percentages and handles drag resizing with bounds.

entries.name: Sidebar navigation rail
entries.description: `components/sidebar-nav.tsx` renders the desktop app icon rail with tooltip-enhanced links that reflect the router path and focus outlines for accessibility.

entries.name: Prompt form hooks
entries.description: `components/prompt-form-hooks.ts` manages speech dictation, mention autocomplete, caret measurement and alias cleanup for the desktop prompt composer.

entries.name: Desktop workspace shell
entries.description: `packages/desktop/src/pages/index.tsx` wires the Solid root view: it boots session/file SDK stores, handles global keyboard shortcuts, lazily creates sessions on prompt submit, and lays out the timeline, editor pane, change list and prompt composer so the desktop client mirrors CLI multi-session workflows.

entries.name: Desktop rich prompt input
entries.description: `components/prompt-input.tsx` renders a contenteditable composer that round-trips to structured `ContentPart` arrays, detects inline `@` mentions to open attachment pickers, inserts pills with cursor restoration and emits normalized parts so the TUI-compatible payload matches CLI prompts.

entries.name: Prompt mention parsing helpers
entries.description: `components/prompt-form-helpers.ts` tokenises prompt text, promotes `@file` references into attachment segments, formats human labels and builds the submission payload, keeping desktop prompts consistent with CLI attachment semantics.

entries.name: Desktop IconButton wrapper
entries.description: `ui/icon-button.tsx` wraps Kobalte's button with opencode variants and sizing, normalising hover/focus states so every toolbar button in the desktop app inherits the same token-based styling.

entries.name: Collapsible panels with arrow affordance
entries.description: `ui/collapsible.tsx` exposes a Solid/Kobalte collapsible with forced mounting and an `Arrow` helper that rotates with the trigger, used by session panels and drawers to keep disclosure behavior consistent.

entries.name: File tree sprite icon chooser
entries.description: `ui/file-icon.tsx` picks SVG sprites from `file-icons/types.ts`, mapping file names, extensions and folder states to a bundled sprite sheet so the desktop explorer renders language-aware icons offline.

entries.name: Sprite icon manifest
entries.description: `ui/file-icons/types.ts` enumerates the generated icon symbol names consumed by `FileIcon`, documenting the sprite inventory shipped with the desktop build.

entries.name: Binary search helpers for session state
entries.description: `utils/binary.ts` provides insert/search helpers that maintain sorted arrays by id, used by desktop stores to merge streamed session updates without reallocating entire lists.

entries.name: Code selection DOM helpers
entries.description: `utils/dom.ts` translates DOM ranges inside code blocks into line/character offsets and vice versa, allowing the desktop prompt composer to capture precise file selections for attachments.

entries.name: Filename and directory helpers
entries.description: `utils/path.ts` normalises desktop path rendering with helpers for basename, parent directory and extension extraction, keeping file lists aligned with CLI output.

entries.name: Desktop Vite build pipeline
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/desktop/vite.config.ts` wires SolidJS, Tailwind and the icons spritesheet plugin while aliasing `@` to `src`, exposing how the desktop shell bundles assets and serves on port 3000 during development.

entries.name: Debug CLI suite
entries.description: `cli/cmd/debug/index.ts` groups debug commands (config, lsp, ripgrep, file, snapshot, wait) and print `Global.Path`, allowing operators to quickly diagnose the CLI environment. Added config/file/lsp/rg/scrap subcommands to display configuration, files, and LSP diagnostics. The script calls CLI commands `cli-debug-suite` And `tool-guide-debug` for regression. Marked as `automation-diagnostics` for environment tests. The script checks `tui-logging` CLI/TUI output.

entries.name: CI formatting fixer
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/script/format.ts` wraps `bun run prettier --write`, and when running inside CI it stages, commits and pushes formatting fixes automatically so pipelines can self-heal style drift. Associated with `automation-release-script` And `cli-upgrade-channel`, since the formatting autopatch is triggered by the same release pipelines.

entries.name: Latest tag synchronizer
entries.description: `github/script/publish` rebuilds the tag `latest`, deletes the old one and reinstalls the link to the latest release `github-v*`so that the marketplace always points to the current assembly artifact.

entries.name: GitHub action release tagging
entries.description: `github/script/release` updates tags `github-v*`, supports flag `--minor` and pushes new tags after version calculation, automating the release of a GitHub Action package.

entries.name: Cross-platform installer
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/install` detects OS/arch combinations, downloads the release zip from GitHub, unpacks to `~/.opencode/bin` and amends shell rc files, standardizing how end users install or update the binary. Works in tandem with `cli-upgrade-channel`, providing a single installation and update script.

entries.name: Release automation pipeline
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/script/publish.ts` queries npm for the previous release, has opencode itself draft the changelog, bumps every package version, runs the opencode/sdk/plugin publish scripts and finalises git tags or snapshot branches depending on preview mode. Uses artifacts `automation-format` and publishing the CLI from `cli-upgrade-channel`, creating a complete release cycle. Operates with the latest specifications from `cli-generate` and pushes the SDK via `sdk-js-client`. The script involves `prompt-builder` (cli-generate, templates) for release preparations.

entries.name: Snapshot debug commands
entries.description: `cli/cmd/debug/snapshot.ts` hangs up subcommands `track`, `patch <hash>` And `diff <hash>` to the Snapshot subsystem, printing git-tree hashes and lists of files, which speeds up the analysis of revert/restore failures in production. Uses `cli-debug-snapshot`, `tool-guide-todowrite` and runtime snapshot API. Marked as `automation-diagnostics` for environment tests.

entries.name: Download stats collector
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/script/stats.ts` paginates GitHub releases, aggregates npm download ranges, appends a prettified row to `STATS.md` and sends metrics to PostHog, producing a reproducible adoption snapshot. Results are integrated into the pipeline `automation-release-script`, supplementing the release with statistics.

entries.name: Session stats formatter
entries.description: `packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/stats.ts` displays table blocks OVERVIEW/COST & TOKENS/TOOL USAGE, normalizing the sum of tokens and building an ascii histogram of the top 10 instruments - a convenient offline report for operators.

entries.name: Turbo task graph
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/turbo.json` defines a canonical set of problems (`build`  `^build`, `typecheck`, `opencode#test`) and cached outputs `dist/**`so that CI and local scripts can reuse package builds without manual dependencies.

entries.name: Config-backed command catalog
entries.description: `command/index.ts` loads custom commands from `Config.get()`, caches them in `Instance.state` and provides `list/get`so that TUI and the server can use a single template directory. Manages `cli-command-catalog` And `tool-guide-*` before executing generators. Marked as `automation-diagnostics` for environment tests. The team is included in `workflow-config`: Prepares CLI/TUI directories.

entries.name: Usage provider backfill
entries.description: `console/scripts/src/backfill-usage-provider.ts` updates up to 90k records in `UsageTable`, replacing `x-ai/grok-code-fast-1` on `grok-code` for provider approval.

entries.name: Promote Zen models secret
entries.description: `core/script/promote-models.ts` gets it `ZEN_MODELS` through `bun sst secret list`, validates `ZenModel.ModelsSchema` and sets the value for the specified stage.

entries.name: Frank stage database reset
entries.description: `console/scripts/src/reset.ts` checks that the stage `frank`, and clears the Account, Billing, Key, Payment, Usage, User and Workspace tables via `Database.use`.

entries.name: Interactive Zen models editor
entries.description: `core/script/update-models.ts` writes current `ZEN_MODELS` to temporary JSON, opens it in `vim`, validates `ZenModel.ModelsSchema` and pushes `bun sst secret set` without specifying the stage.

entries.name: Channel-aware version script
entries.description: `packages/script/src/index.ts` fixes the required bun@1.3.0, calculates the channel from `OPENCODE_CHANNEL` or git branches, builds a preview version `0.0.0-<channel>-<timestamp>` and for latest downloads npm metadata, increasing the semantic component depending on `OPENCODE_BUMP`.

entries.name: Multi-target CLI build script
entries.description: `packages/opencode/script/build.ts` iterates the supported OS/arch pairs, cross-compiles the Go TUI, bundles Bun binaries with version defines and packages parcel watcher shims into per-platform distributions.

entries.name: Release publishing orchestrator
entries.description: `packages/opencode/script/publish.ts` reuses the build output to smoke-test binaries, assemble the npm meta-package, publish optional dependencies per platform and update AUR/Homebrew when not in preview.

entries.name: Config schema generator
entries.description: `packages/opencode/script/schema.ts` serialises `Config.Info` into JSON Schema, adding examples from defaults, enforcing `additionalProperties: false` and enabling JSONC extras for opencode configuration.

entries.name: Monorepo Bun install lock
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/bunfig.toml` sets `install.exact = true` so Bun adheres to exact dependency versions across workspaces, preventing accidental semver drift in automation scripts.

entries.name: CLI test preload config
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/bunfig.toml` preloads `test/preload.ts` for Bun test runs, wiring the CLI test harness with global mocks before suites execute.

entries.name: SES mail sender
entries.description: `console/core/src/aws.ts` lazily initiates `AwsClient` from secret and sends letters through `email.us-east-1.amazonaws.com`, generating text and HTML bodies.

entries.name: Docs edge redirector
entries.description: `routes/docs/index.ts` And `[...path].ts` clone the request and proxy it to `https://docs.opencode.ai`, saving the method, headers and body for any HTTP method.

entries.name: Cloudflare resource loader
entries.description: `resource.cloudflare.ts` proxy Cloudflare `env`, deserializes JSON secrets and throws an error if the value is not bound in `sst.config.ts`, synchronizing the console runtime with the infrastructure.

entries.name: Composite action installer
entries.description: `github/action.yml` downloads CLI via curl-install script, installs bun, executes `bun install` and starts `index.ts` with MODEL/SHARE/TOKEN variables, packaging the launch into GitHub Actions.

entries.name: GitHub comment workflow
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/github/index.ts` handles issue comment events, installs the opencode GitHub App if needed, spins up a session via the SDK, summarises PR context and pushes commits or new branches, then replies with results and share links. Workflow reuses post `automation-release-script` and CLI mode `cli-run`.

entries.name: GitHub App polling
entries.description: `installGitHubApp` from `cli/cmd/github.ts` opens installation page `opencode-agent`, interrogates `api.opencode.ai/get_github_app_installation` up to 120 times and notifies the user of success/error, ensuring completion of onboarding without manual API.

entries.name: CLI GitHub agent installer
entries.description: Team `opencode github install` (`src/cli/cmd/github.ts`) defines a git repository, interactively selects a provider, starts the GitHub App installation, and displays the next steps to associate the repository with the cloud agent.

entries.name: Copilot device flow
entries.description: `auth/github-copilot.ts` initiates device-code flow GitHub, returns a code/verification link to the user and queries the OAuth endpoint, saving the refresh token via `Auth.set` upon successful authorization.

entries.name: Copilot API refresh
entries.description: `AuthGithubCopilot.access()` updates GitHub Copilot API token, requests `copilot_internal/v2/token` with the client's VSCode headers and overwrites access/expiry in `Auth`so that tools can make signed queries.

entries.name: Workflow generator
entries.description: `addWorkflowFiles()` writes down `.github/workflows/opencode.yml` with action `sst/opencode/github@latest`, pulls up a list of environment variables from the selected provider and connects OIDC/secret steps to comments `/oc` launched the agent.

entries.name: Clangd release fetcher
entries.description: Clangd's block `lsp/server.ts` refers to releases `clangd/clangd`, selects a zip for the platform, unpacks the binary and connects it to PATH, covering the manual installation of the C/C++ LSP.

entries.name: ElixirLS auto-download
entries.description: IN `lsp/server.ts` description ElixirLS downloads master release from GitHub, unpacks, executes `mix elixir_ls.release2` and launches the resulting binary when local `elixir-ls` absent.

entries.name: ZLS release bootstrap
entries.description: `lsp/server.ts` for Zig LSP calls the GitHub API, selects an archive for the current platform, unpacks it into `Global.Path.bin` and sets permissions, which allows you to run zls without manual installation.

entries.name: MCP add CLI
entries.description: `opencode mcp add` (`cli/cmd/mcp.ts`) guides the user through the selection of a name, remote/local types, validates the URL and checks the availability of the server via the StreamableHTTP transport, generating entries for the MCP configuration.

entries.name: MCP client manager
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/mcp/index.ts` reads configured MCP servers, connects via HTTP or stdio transports, verifies tool lists and keeps the clients alive in an `Instance.state` cache, exposing a combined tool registry for the runtime.

entries.name: Models.dev cache
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/provider/models.ts` downloads the models.dev catalog with the opencode user-agent, caches it in `Global.Path.cache` and exposes provider metadata with Zod validation for downstream tooling. Data is consumed by the directory `cli-models` and bootloader `integrations-provider-loader`.

entries.name: Provider loader
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/provider/provider.ts` merges config overrides, injects provider-specific loaders (Anthropic, Bedrock, Vertex, etc.) and falls back to installing SDKs through Bun when required, resolving model handles for the runtime. The resolver is called `cli-run` And `integrations-github-action` when selecting models.

entries.name: ProviderTransform message adapter
entries.description: `packages/opencode/src/provider/transform.ts` normalizes tool-call identifiers, adds cache options for Anthropic/OpenRouter/OpenAI and calculates temperature/Reasoning settings so that different SDK providers accept a unified message pipeline.

entries.name: Slack agent relay
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/slack/src/index.ts` boots a Bolt app in socket mode, creates opencode sessions per thread, shares links and streams tool updates back to Slack, effectively mirroring CLI conversations into channels. Messages broadcast events `share-sync-client` and use `integrations-mcp-clients` for connected instruments.

entries.name: OpenAI chat completions bridge
entries.description: `zen/v1/chat/completions.ts` includes `stream_options.include_usage`, uses Bearer `authorization` and stores reasoning/cached tokens in normalized usage for cost calculation.

entries.name: Zen handler enforces workspace billing limits
entries.description: `routes/zen/handler.ts` through `authenticate` pulls out the key, checks the balance, monthly limits and disabled models, throws `MonthlyLimitError`/`UserLimitError` and respects free workspaces before proxying the request.

entries.name: Streaming usage accounting and auto-reload
entries.description: `handler.ts` aggregates usage into `trackUsage`, calculates cost based on tariffs `cost`/`cost200K`, writes tokens to `UsageTable`, reduces balance and trigger `reload()` automatically replenishes your account.

entries.name: Anthropic /messages proxy
entries.description: `zen/v1/messages.ts` forces `service_tier` in body, log in via `x-api-key`, parses SSE usage and normalizes tokens for further billing.

entries.name: Responses SSE usage capture
entries.description: `zen/v1/responses.ts` reads `event: response.completed`, pulls out usage, subtracts reasoning and cached tokens and returns a structure for general billing.

entries.name: Account registry helpers
entries.description: `console/core/src/account.ts` creates accounts with a ULID prefix, and also searches for them by email or id in `AccountTable` in transactions.

entries.name: Stripe-backed workspace billing
entries.description: `console/core/src/billing.ts` creates a Stripe client, services `Billing.reload`, `generateCheckoutUrl`, `generateSessionUrl` And `generateReceiptUrl`, updating balance and records `BillingTable`/`PaymentTable` in transactions.

entries.name: Planetscale drizzle context
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/console/core/src/drizzle/index.ts` encapsulates the Planetscale client and AsyncLocalStorage transactions so that handlers from `console-stack` reused the drizzle connection, providing `Database.use/transaction` and postponed `effects` for consistent access to data.

entries.name: Prefix-aware ULID generator
entries.description: `console/core/src/identifier.ts` stores prefixes (`acc`, `wrk`, `pay` etc.), checks the given ID for a match and generates new ULIDs with the required prefix.

entries.name: Workspace model allow/deny list
entries.description: `console/core/src/model.ts` reads `ZEN_MODELS` through `ZenModel.list()` and supports `Model.disable`/`Model.enable`, saving disabled models in `ModelTable`.

entries.name: Bring-your-own provider store
entries.description: `console/core/src/provider.ts` returns a list of active providers, allows admins to save or delete credential via upsert in `ProviderTable`, marking soft-delete.

entries.name: Workspace user lifecycle
entries.description: `console/core/src/user.ts` invites participants, creates API keys for new accounts, monitors monthly limits and updates `timeSeen` through `Actor`.

entries.name: Console accounts
entries.description: `schema/account.sql.ts` describes the base account table with ULID and unique email that users and billing reference when creating a workspace.

entries.name: Billing ledger tables
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/console/core/src/schema/billing.sql.ts` declares billing, payment and usage tables with Stripe identifiers, consumption counters and reload flags, enabling metered billing in Planetscale.

entries.name: Planetscale drizzle provider
entries.description: `console/core/src/drizzle/index.ts` creates a Planetscale client via `console-resource`, caches it, provides TransactionContext and functions `use/transaction/effect`, ensuring reusable transactions across all services.

entries.name: Drizzle column helpers
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/console/core/src/drizzle/types.ts` centralises ULID, timestamp and workspace column helpers plus `currency` bigints, keeping console schemas consistent across tables.

entries.name: API Key Service
entries.description: `console/core/src/key.ts` manages API keys: joins users and accounts, hides the value for other people's keys and generates `sk-` secrets from crypto-random, keeping ULID and soft-delete flag.

entries.name: workspace API keys
entries.description: `schema/key.sql.ts` inherits workspaceColumns, stores the key name, user ULID and time of use, and a global unique index on the key field prevents duplicate secrets.

entries.name: Model Profiles
entries.description: `schema/model.sql.ts` stores a list of selected models on the workspace, duplicates the timestamp fields and uniquely identifies the workspace/model combination, which allows you to quickly channel the available options into the UI.

entries.name: Provider credentials store
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/console/core/src/schema/provider.sql.ts` stores workspace provider configs with JSON credentials and unique workspace/provider indexes, powering console-side key management.

entries.name: Provider storage
entries.description: `schema/provider.sql.ts` defines a provider table with workspace scope, JSON-credentials and a unique index on (workspace, provider), allowing you to accumulate model tokens and hide remote providers by soft deletion.

entries.name: Workspace user table
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/console/core/src/schema/user.sql.ts` defines the per-workspace user table with role enums, usage counters and indexes on account/email, backing access control in the console.

entries.name: Workspace provisioning
entries.description: `console/core/src/workspace.ts` creates a workspace in a transaction: adds an entry to the WorkspaceTable, the first admin user, billing and automatically generates an API key via `Key.create`, after which it supports rename and soft-delete.

entries.name: Workspace core table
entries.description: `packages/console/core/src/schema/workspace.sql.ts` describes the workspace table with ULID keys, slug-unique index and timestamps, forming the basis for all workspace-dependent entities.

entries.name: Drizzle config for console
entries.description: `console/core/drizzle.config.ts` assembles an ORM schema (`./src/**/*.sql.ts`), enables strict/verbose mode and pulls Planetscale creds from `Resource.Database`, including TLS `rejectUnauthorized: false`so that migrations are performed in the edge environment.

entries.name: Auth provider registry
entries.description: `console/core/src/schema/auth.sql.ts` declares the `auth` table with provider enums, subject identifiers and unique constraints so console sessions can tie GitHub/Google/OpenAuth subjects back to accounts.

entries.name: JS client wrapper
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/sdk/js/src/client.ts` re-exports the generated Stainless client and exposes `createOpencodeClient`, giving Node or Bun callers a typed SDK factory. Generated OpenAPI from `cli-generate` serves as the basis for the client and is synchronized with releases `automation-release-script`.

entries.name: JS server launcher
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/sdk/js/src/server.ts` spawns `opencode serve` with configurable host/port and wraps the TUI invocation, enabling programmatic orchestration from JavaScript.

entries.name: Go session service
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/sdk/go/session.go` (generated by Stainless) exposes Go methods for session creation, prompts, sharing and permissions, giving Go clients first-class bindings to the API.

entries.name: VSCode terminal integration
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/sdks/vscode/src/extension.ts` registers commands that launch an opencode terminal beside the active editor, stream prompts to the TUI and annotate selections, integrating the CLI with VS Code.

entries.name: Go SDK client scaffold
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/client.go` forms `Client` with all services, inherits `DefaultClientOptions()` from env `OPENCODE_BASE_URL` and provides universal `Execute/Get/Post/...` wrappers for arbitrary HTTP calls.

entries.name: RequestOption utilities
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/option/requestoption.go` provides functions `WithBaseURL`, `WithHTTPClient`, `WithMiddleware`, `WithHeader*`, `WithMaxRetries` etc., allowing you to customize transport and SDK requests without forking the client.

entries.name: Event SSE stream
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/event.go` configures `EventService.ListStreaming`by adding a title `Accept: text/event-stream` and returning `ssestream.Stream` with all types of events (message.part, file.watcher, permission, etc.), which simplifies realtime subscription.

entries.name: TUI control API
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/tui.go` implements methods `AppendPrompt`, `ExecuteCommand`, `OpenModels`, `ShowToast` etc., proxying POST to `/tui/*` and combining options to let Go integrations drive the terminal UI.

entries.name: Stainless generation script
entries.description: `packages/sdk/stainless/generate.ts` recreates OpenAPI via `bun dev generate`, launches `stl builds create --+target go` and replaces the directory `packages/sdk/go`, ensuring the SDK is in sync with the latest API.

entries.name: Go AgentService client
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/agent.go` provides the generated `AgentService` with typed agent models, including permission enums for bash, edit and webfetch, so Go integrations can list available agents with compile-time safety.

entries.name: Go AppService logging & providers
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/app.go` exposes `AppService` helpers for writing log entries and fetching provider inventories with cost, limits and installation metadata, mirroring opencode runtime capabilities in Go.

entries.name: Go CommandService models
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/command.go` generates `CommandService`, returning command templates with agent bindings and descriptions so external Go tools can inspect CLI presets via the REST API.

entries.name: Go ConfigService schema
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/config.go` materialises the expansive configuration schemaincluding agent presets, formatter overrides, plugin lists and watcher settingsso typed Go clients can hydrate `.opencode` state.

entries.name: Go FileService endpoints
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/file.go` implements file list, read and status endpoints with enums for change status and node types, ensuring Go callers receive structured diff and tree results.

entries.name: Go FindService search
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/find.go` adds `FindService` with helpers for file globbing, workspace symbols and text search, mapping responses to typed structures compatible with LSP metadata.

entries.name: Go ProjectService
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/project.go` offers list and current project calls with typed `Project` structs containing worktree, VCS and timestamps so Go apps can mirror opencode workspace discovery.

entries.name: Go session permission API
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/sessionpermission.go` defines `SessionPermissionService` to respond to permission prompts and models the pattern union, enabling Go services to approve or deny tool access remotely.

entries.name: Go debug logging middleware
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/option/middleware.go` ships `WithDebugLog` request middleware that dumps HTTP requests and responses, aiding SDK consumers when debugging API interactions.

entries.name: Go PathService
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/path.go` exposes `PathService` returning opencode's config, state and worktree directories, letting SDK callers mirror CLI path resolution.

entries.name: Shared SDK error models
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/shared/shared.go` defines reusable error payloads like `ProviderAuthError` and `MessageAbortedError`, aligning Go event streams with CLI error taxonomies.

entries.name: JS SDK entrypoint
entries.description: `packages/sdk/js/src/index.ts` exports the generated client/server builders and provides `createOpencode` which spins up a dev server and returns a preconfigured HTTP client for Node or browser usage.

entries.name: JS client generator core
entries.description: `packages/sdk/js/src/gen/client/client.gen.ts` implements request assembly, interceptor pipelines and response parsing for the JavaScript SDK, supporting streaming, auth injection and custom fetch implementations.

entries.name: JS client utility helpers
entries.description: `packages/sdk/js/src/gen/core/utils.gen.ts` houses helpers for URL building, interceptor creation, header merging and auth parameter resolution that underpin every SDK request.

entries.name: JS request parameter typing
entries.description: `packages/sdk/js/src/gen/core/params.gen.ts` exports TypeScript types and serializers for request options, bodies and retry policies, giving consumers typed access to every opencode endpoint configuration.

entries.name: Project REST endpoints
entries.description: `server/project.ts` describes routes `/project` And `/project/current` with Hono OpenAPI schemas, giving the SDK access to a list of working trees and the active project.

entries.name: JS SDK OpenAPI build
entries.description: `sdk/js/script/build.ts` runs the Stainless generator via `bun dev generate`, writes client code with `@hey-api/openapi-ts`, prettifies output and type-checks, producing the TypeScript SDK bundle.

entries.name: JS SDK publish pipeline
entries.description: `sdk/js/script/publish.ts` reuses the build, rewrites `package.json` exports to point at `dist` artifacts and publishes with Bun using the release channel tag, restoring the original manifest afterwards.

entries.name: JS SDK batch prompt example
entries.description: `sdk/js/example/example.ts` spins up the local server helper and streams through project files, creating sessions and prompting the API to generate tests, demonstrating concurrent usage of the JS client.

entries.name: Generated SSE stream helper
entries.description: `sdk/js/src/gen/core/serverSentEvents.gen.ts` implements reconnecting SSE consumption with backoff, last-event-id replay and transformer hooks, powering streaming endpoints in the JS SDK.

entries.name: Go SDK error aliases
entries.description: `sdk/go/aliases.go` re-exports generated error types (ProviderAuthError, MessageAbortedError, UnknownError) so consumers import stable names without touching the internal packages.

entries.name: Param field helpers
entries.description: `sdk/go/field.go` exposes `F`, `Null`, `Raw`, `Int/String/Float/Bool` helpers and the file wrapper so callers can mark Go request fields as present, null or raw without manipulating `param.Field` directly.

entries.name: Go SDK version constant
entries.description: `sdk/go/internal/version.go` centralizes the go module version for user-agent strings and release tooling (`x-release-please` comment), keeping request headers aligned with published artifacts.

entries.name: Union marker types
entries.description: `sdk/go/shared/union.go` provides empty types that satisfy generated union interfaces, enabling compile-time enforcement of union payloads in generated request structs.

entries.name: HTTP error wrapper
entries.description: `sdk/go/internal/apierror/apierror.go` defines the error type returned by the client, capturing raw JSON, status code and helpers to dump requests/responses for debugging.

entries.name: Request config builder
entries.description: `sdk/go/internal/requestconfig/requestconfig.go` assembles HTTP requests with retry headers, OS/arch metadata, JSON/form/query serializers and request option application, forming the backbone of every Go SDK call.

entries.name: Multipart form encoder
entries.description: `sdk/go/internal/apiform/encoder.go` with `form.go` and `tag.go` reflect over structs, honour form/json tags and stream multipart bodies, enabling generated clients to upload files and complex bodies.

entries.name: JSON encoder with union support
entries.description: `sdk/go/internal/apijson/encoder.go` serializes structs with union metadata, escaping SJSON keys and respecting `param.Field` wrappers so outgoing bodies mirror the schema.

entries.name: JSON decoder with strictness levels
entries.description: `sdk/go/internal/apijson/decoder.go` plus `field.go` parse API responses via gjson, tracking exactness, metadata fields and populating `apijson.Field` so the SDK preserves unknown fields.

entries.name: Union registry
entries.description: `sdk/go/internal/apijson/registry.go` registers discriminator values and helper wrappers so generated union types can route deserialization through `UnmarshalRoot`.

entries.name: Struct field porter
entries.description: `sdk/go/internal/apijson/port.go` copies values and raw JSON metadata between struct representations, letting wrapper types embed generated payloads without losing unknown fields.

entries.name: Query encoder
entries.description: `sdk/go/internal/apiquery/encoder.go`, `query.go` and `tag.go` flatten structs into url.Values with configurable array/nested formats, powering query serialization for GET endpoints.

entries.name: Param field struct
entries.description: `sdk/go/internal/param/field.go` defines the generic `Field[T]` wrapper with present/null/raw flags used throughout the Go SDK to distinguish omitted, explicit null and raw payloads.

entries.name: Mock server test guard
entries.description: `sdk/go/internal/testutil/testutil.go` checks if the Prism mock server is running and skips SDK tests when `SKIP_MOCK_TESTS=true`, preventing false positives in CI.

entries.name: SSE stream wrapper
entries.description: `sdk/go/packages/ssestream/ssestream.go` provides a decoder registry and typed `Stream[T]` wrapper that powers Go event streaming with automatic JSON decoding and resource cleanup.

entries.name: VS Code extension bundler
entries.description: `sdks/vscode/esbuild.js` bundles the extension entry with esbuild, registers a watch-friendly problem matcher plugin and toggles minification/sourcemaps between dev and production.

entries.name: VS Code ESLint flat config
entries.description: `sdks/vscode/eslint.config.mjs` enables the TypeScript ESLint plugin, enforces naming conventions for imports and warns on common stylistic issues in the extension source.

entries.name: VS Code test harness config
entries.description: `sdks/vscode/.vscode-test.mjs` wires the official `@vscode/test-cli` to run compiled tests under `out/test/**/*.test.js`, standardising extension integration tests.

entries.name: Workspace server actions
entries.description: `routes/workspace/common.tsx` exports SolidStart `query`/`action` functions for checking login, issuing checkout URL Stripe and caching workspace status so that UI Zen uses authorized drizzle calls without duplicating logic.

entries.name: Console async context
entries.description: `packages/console/core/src/context.ts` wraps `AsyncLocalStorage` V `Context.create`by providing `use/provide` and exception `NotFound`, if the context is not specified. Console utilities use it to pass request scoped data without additional arguments.

entries.name: Console log namespace
entries.description: `packages/console/core/src/util/log.ts` builds a logger on top `Context.create`, combines global and local tags, supports `tag`/`clone` and prints key=value to stdout. `provide` extends context to allow components to add trace fields.

entries.name: Zod-backed server helpers
entries.description: `core/src/util/fn.ts` wraps handlers in zod: `fn(schema, cb)` parses the input, provides `force` for trusted paths and preserves the schema, making it easier to validate extraneous data.

entries.name: Memoized resource helper
entries.description: `core/src/util/memo.ts` implements a lazy cache with `reset` and an optional async cleanup, allowing resources (such as Stripe clients) to be reused between requests to workers.

entries.name: Pricing unit converter
entries.description: `core/src/util/price.ts` converts dollars to microcents (`Math.round(amount * 1_000_000)`), unifying the calculation of limits and payments before recording in Planetscale.

entries.name: API key admin styling
entries.description: `keys/key-section.module.css` lays out empty states, creation forms and API key tables with dashed placeholders and hover-revealed action buttons.

entries.name: Member management styling
entries.description: `members/member-section.module.css` formats invite forms, responsive tables and inline action rows, hiding destructive buttons until hover.

entries.name: Role dropdown UI
