entries.description: `members/role-dropdown.css` skins the role selector trigger, dropdown list and selected state, applying accent outlines on focus and hover surfaces for admins.

entries.name: Provider table styling
entries.description: `provider-section.module.css` sizes provider columns, styles inline key editing forms and reveals delete forms on hover to keep secrets legible yet safe.

entries.name: Model toggle styling
entries.description: `model-section.module.css` manages the models table, custom toggle switches and responsive column hiding so admins can enable providers cleanly on any screen.

entries.name: New user onboarding layout
entries.description: `new-user-section.module.css` builds the dashed onboarding panel, feature grid and API key highlight block that guides first-time workspace admins.

entries.name: Workspace settings form layout
entries.description: `settings/settings-section.module.css` constrains settings rows, spaces button/input groups and applies accent focus shadows for domain and slug updates.

entries.name: Agent create wizard
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/agent.ts` drives an interactive flow with @clack prompts, calls `Agent.generate` to scaffold metadata, lets the user prune tool access and writes the agent markdown into the selected scope (`global` or project `.opencode`). Created agents are registered via `core-agent-registry` and run by commands `cli-run`. Starts `cli-tui` and automation workflows for agent training.

entries.name: Credential manager
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/auth.ts` lists configured providers, supports well-known OIDC login flows, invokes plugin auth handlers and persists tokens via the Auth store, unifying how CLI users provision model credentials. Connects to `console-admin` authorization and CLI/TUI login.

entries.name: CLI bootstrap wrapper
entries.description: `cli/bootstrap.ts` wraps commands in `Instance.provide`, launches `InstanceBootstrap` and guarantees `Instance.dispose()` after execution, streamlining the initialization of plugins, formatter, and LSPs per CLI run. Generic bootstrap splits init between `cli-run`, `cli-tui` and headless `cli-serve`. Generic bootstrap is called `cli-composition`, `cli-run`, `cli-tui` And `automation-release-script`. The route belongs to the tag `terminal-bridge`, linking the CLI and TUI.

entries.name: Yargs command helper
entries.description: `cli/cmd/cmd.ts` exports a helper function that returns `CommandModule` without a wrapper so that CLI commands can share builder/handler types and register through a single helper. He is called `cli-tui` and other yargs commands to unify the CLI interface. Helper is used `cli-generate`, `cli-tui`, `tool-guide-*` and GitHub workflows. Helper included in `terminal-bridge` chain (`cli-tui`, `cli-serve`).

entries.name: Session export command
entries.description: `cli/cmd/export.ts` offers interactive session selection via `@clack/prompts`, uses `Session.list/get/messages` and outputs a JSON dump of history, which allows you to quickly archive correspondence. Used `tool-guide-export` and TUI dialogs for saving sessions.

entries.name: OpenAPI generator
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/generate.ts` invokes the in-process server's `openapi()` helper and pretty-prints the spec to stdout, letting pipelines snapshot the current HTTP surface. The generated specification is used in `sdk-js-client` and publications `automation-release-script`. The command is used by GitHub workflow and `cli-tui` hint generator. The team generates tips for `tool-guide-*`, `cli-template-*` and release scripts. The team is included in `terminal-bridge`: Generates hints for TUI and automation.

entries.name: GitHub agent install command
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/github.ts` expands `cli-composition` interactive installation script: determines the git repository, polls `/get_github_app_installation` from `sync-server-api`, adds workflow files and guides the user through setting up secrets via clack prompts. The CLI command is called by the GitHub App integration and TUI to manage the agent.

entries.name: IDE extension installer
entries.description: `ide/index.ts` detects supported IDEs (Windsurf, VS Code, Cursor, VSCodium), detects running clients and installs extension `sst-dev.opencode` through `--install-extension`, notifying the bus about completion. IDE installer connects to `cli-tui` onboarding and console workspace.

entries.name: MCP server onboarding
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/mcp.ts` walks users through registering local or remote Model Context Protocol servers, validates remote URLs via `StreamableHTTPClientTransport` and records the setup for runtime use. Saved servers are consumed by runtime `integrations-mcp-clients` and run from `cli-run`. MCP command is registered in `tool-guide-task` and TUI panels.

entries.name: Model catalog lister
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/models.ts` runs inside an `Instance.provide` context, collects providers from `Provider.list()` and prints `provider/model` identifiers, making it easy to choose valid targets for `opencode run`. The command is used `cli-serve` and GitHub workflows for model inventory. Team reads `model-catalog` to display a list of models.

entries.name: Run session orchestrator
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/run.ts` handles session reuse, auto-sharing, agent/model selection and stream printingswitching between formatted and JSON event modesso `opencode run` serves both humans and automation. Exit is used to publish the API `cli-generate`, and agents connect via `cli-agent-create`. General runner serves `cli-tui`, `cli-serve` and GitHub actions.

entries.name: Headless server launcher
entries.description: `cli/cmd/serve.ts` raises the HTTP server via `Server.listen`, accepts parameters `--port/--hostname` and blocks on the event, turning the CLI into an independent API process for remote clients. Used `cli-tui` And `terminal-ui` bridge for headless mode. Headless mode serves `tui-app-core`, `cli-attach-tui` and GitHub Actions. Labeled as `terminal-bridge`, serves TUI and headless clients.

entries.name: Upgrade command dispatcher
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/upgrade.ts` detects the current installation method, fetches the latest version when none is provided and delegates to `Installation.upgrade`, surfacing spinner feedback and errors through @clack prompts. The channel change manager is called by the release pipeline and the TUI updater. The command is called `cli-installation-management`, `automation-release-script` and TUI update. Included in `terminal-bridge`, providing terminal client updates.

entries.name: Debug toolkit entrypoint
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/debug/index.ts` registers the command `opencode debug` with sub-items config/lsp/rg/file/snapshot/scrap/paths and wait mode, calling `bootstrap` to access the worker instance and print XDG paths via `Global.Path`. Debug-suite connects to `tool-guide-debug` and diagnostics `cli-serve`. The team participates in `automation-diagnostics` pipelines and tool guides. The team analyzes `tui-logging` records and diagnoses CLI.

entries.name: `debug config` configuration dump
entries.description: Through `opencode debug config` (`projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/debug/config.ts`) CLI raises `Instance` and outputs the validated `Config.get()` JSON, which allows you to quickly check the combined `.opencode` and flag settings. Used by TUI diagnostics and automation checks for configs. The team participates in `automation-diagnostics` pipelines and tool guides.

entries.name: `debug file` filesystem probes
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/debug/file.ts` adds read/list/status/search subcommands, which through `File` The APIs are read, listed and searched for the repository using `bootstrap` to capture the git context and reuse the agent logic. The team analyzes file-tools for TUI and automation pipelines.

entries.name: `debug lsp` diagnostics
entries.description: Team `opencode debug lsp` (`projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/debug/lsp.ts`) warms up the LSP through `LSP.touchFile`, collects workspace/document symbols and measures time `Log.Default.time`, helping to check server registration and indexing. LSP diagnostics is called `cli-tui` And `tool-guide-lsp-*`.

entries.name: `debug rg` ripgrep helpers
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/debug/ripgrep.ts` provides `tree/files/search` subparagraphs that wrap `Ripgrep.tree/files/search` and allow you to limit the results by testing ripgrep cache and glob filtering from the CLI. Ripgrep check is built into TUI and tool guides.

entries.name: `debug snapshot` history tools
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/debug/snapshot.ts` reveals `track/patch/diff` over `Snapshot` API, allowing you to track temporary snapshots of files in the CLI, apply diffs and quickly analyze saved changes. Serves as TUI and automation for snapshot validation. The team participates in `automation-diagnostics` pipelines and tool guides.

entries.name: `debug scrap` project introspection
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/debug/scrap.ts` uses `Project.list()` and timer `Log.Default.time`to quickly inspect registered projects and measure metadata collection time. Used TUI debugging and release QA.

entries.name: Session stats formatter
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/cli/cmd/stats.ts` defines a typed session metrics structure and function `displayStats`, which builds ASCII tables for token volumes, costs, and tool usage, setting the stage for future implementation `opencode stats`. The command is used by TUI dashboards and console workspace statistics.

entries.name: Apply_patch parser
entries.description: `patch/index.ts` implements the apply_patch format parser, splits Add/Update/Delete headers, restores hunks and calculates new contents, feeding multi-file patches and CLI restore. Parser is used `tool-guide-patch` and CLI diff commands.

entries.name: Multi-file patch application
entries.description: `PatchTool` (`packages/opencode/src/tool/patch.ts`) parses apply_patch payloads, enforces workspace boundaries, requests edit permissions and publishes watcher events after applying adds, updates, deletes or moves across many files. The team is connected to `tool-guide-patch`, GitHub automation and TUI conversations.

entries.name: Guarded bash execution
entries.description: `BashTool` (`packages/opencode/src/tool/bash.ts`) parses commands with tree-sitter, applies wildcard permissions, rejects paths outside the worktree and limits runtime, ensuring shell access honors user policy. Calls the team `cli-template-commit-command` and release pipeline automation.

entries.name: Tool definition contract
entries.description: `Tool.define` (`packages/opencode/src/tool/tool.ts`) wraps async initialisers, provides execution context metadata and enforces Zod argument validation so session tools return titles, outputs and optional attachments uniformly. Registry reads `tool-guide-*` and CLI help.

entries.name: Diff-based edit tool
entries.description: `EditTool` (`packages/opencode/src/tool/edit.ts`) validates replacements, enforces read-before-write via `FileTime`, approval for ask-mode requests and triggers LSP diagnostics so edits surface compile errors immediately. The module is connected from `tui-components` editor and from `tool-guide-edit`.

entries.name: Glob listing tool
entries.description: `GlobTool` (`packages/opencode/src/tool/glob.ts`) reuses ripgrep file enumeration with additional glob filters, resolving relative roots and capping results to 100 paths for responsive file discovery.

entries.name: Ripgrep search tool
entries.description: `GrepTool` (`packages/opencode/src/tool/grep.ts`) shells out to the bundled ripgrep binary, sorts matches by modification time and truncates after 100 entries, giving agents concise regex search results.

entries.name: Fallback invalid tool
entries.description: `tool/invalid.ts` defines a tool that returns an explanation about invalid arguments and prevents silent crashes on invalid calls, saving agent UX.

entries.name: Directory summary tool
entries.description: `ListTool` (`packages/opencode/src/tool/ls.ts`) builds directory trees using ripgrep output, applies default ignore globs (node_modules, dist, etc.) and returns a truncated hierarchy to help agents inspect project layout.

entries.name: LSP diagnostics tool
entries.description: `tool/lsp-diagnostics.ts` causes `LSP.touchFile` awaiting diagnostics and displays a formatted error, giving agents easy access to LSP prompts. The tool is included in `lsp-backend`using LSP server components.

entries.name: LSP hover tool
entries.description: `tool/lsp-hover.ts` opens the file in the LSP client, calls `textDocument/hover` and returns JSON with documents, allowing agents to retrieve character types and descriptions. The tool is included in `lsp-backend`using LSP server components.

entries.name: Sequential edit automation
entries.description: `tool/multiedit.ts` calls repeatedly `EditTool` for a set of replacements, preserving session context and diff metadata, allowing the agent to apply multiple edits with a single request.

entries.name: Read tool with previews
entries.description: `ReadTool` (`packages/opencode/src/tool/read.ts`) enforces workspace constraints, supports image attachments when models allow, caps line lengths and returns numbered snippets, warming LSP state for subsequent diagnostics. Handler connects to `tool-guide-read` and TUI file lists. The team contacts `terminal-clipboard` and TUI paste.

entries.name: Tool registry and loaders
entries.description: `ToolRegistry` (`packages/opencode/src/tool/registry.ts`) loads built-in tools, scans user config directories, merges plugin-provided definitions and computes per-agent enablement flags, giving the prompt engine a consolidated catalogue. Declaration is used `cli-command-catalog` And `tool-guide-*`to sync help across tools. Catalog is loading `cli-command-catalog`, `tool-guide-*` and automation.

entries.name: Subagent task launcher
entries.description: `TaskTool` (`packages/opencode/src/tool/task.ts`) lists non-primary agents, spawns child sessions with custom prompts, streams tool metadata back to the parent and aborts via session locks when cancelled. Call in use `cli-run` and GitHub workflows for agent-based tasks.

entries.name: Todo management tools
entries.description: `TodoWriteTool` and `TodoReadTool` (`packages/opencode/src/tool/todo.ts`) persist todo arrays per session, returning counts and JSON payloads so agents can synchronize worklists with the CLI sidebar. The command is synchronized with `tool-guide-todoread/todowrite` and TUI todo panels.

entries.name: Permissioned web fetch
entries.description: `WebFetchTool` (`packages/opencode/src/tool/webfetch.ts`) validates URLs, enforces size and timeout limits, respects config permissions and converts HTML to markdown or plain text to supply safe remote context.

entries.name: Write tool with diff feedback
entries.description: `WriteTool` (`packages/opencode/src/tool/write.ts`) requires absolute paths inside the project, asks for confirmation in ask-mode, generates diffs and re-runs LSP diagnostics so agents get immediate error feedback after writes. The command is used `cli-template-*` and GitHub Actions via `cli-serve`.

entries.name: AsyncQueue primitive
entries.description: `util/queue.ts` provides a simple asynchronous queue with `push` And `next`, used by the TUI/Server bridge to transmit requests and responses. The queue serves `cli-serve` and streaming tools.

entries.name: Token estimate helper
entries.description: `util/token.ts` roughly estimates the number of tokens (1 token  4 characters) for texts, helping to limit generation and session compaction. Score used `tool-guide-*` and CLI runtime for limits.

entries.name: Named error factory
entries.description: `util/error.ts` implements `NamedError.create`, returning classes with zod schema, `isInstance` And `toObject`, plus type `UnknownError`. This gives a uniform error format for API, CLI and Bus.

entries.name: Formatter registry
entries.description: `packages/opencode/src/format/index.ts` collects built-in formatters, mixes them with `Config.formatter`, caches `enabled` flags and subscribes to `File.Event.Edited`. When files change, it runs Bun.spawn commands with environment variables and logs success or errors. Used `cli-tui` And `runtime-tools` when formatting events.

entries.name: Filesystem helpers
entries.description: `util/filesystem.ts` provides utilities `overlaps`/`contains`, iterable `up`, `findUp` And `globUp`, using Bun.Glob and absolute paths. They allow you to search for configs and check path intersections in formatters and tooltips.

entries.name: Formatter bundle
entries.description: `packages/opencode/src/format/formatter.ts` describes a set of formatters (prettier, biome, gofmt, zig, ruff, etc.) with commands, extensions and checks `enabled()` through `Bun.which` and search for configs. The registry supplies Format.init data. Used `cli-tui` And `runtime-tools` when formatting events.

entries.name: Structured logger
entries.description: `util/log.ts` initializes the file log (`Log.init`), controls levels `DEBUG..ERROR`, caches loggers by service and adds timers `logger.time`. It redirects `stderr` to a log file and formats messages with json fields. Used `cli-tui` And `runtime-tools` when formatting events.

entries.name: Async context factory
entries.description: `util/context.ts` creates a named `AsyncLocalStorage`, throwing away `Context.NotFound`, if the context is not set, and provides `provide/use` couples. It is used by loggers, buses and other platform services for request scoped data. Used `cli-tui` And `runtime-tools` when formatting events.

entries.name: Defer helper
entries.description: `util/defer.ts` returns an object with `[Symbol.dispose]` And `[Symbol.asyncDispose]`, wrapping the function in a guaranteed execution upon completion of the block `using`. It is used by sessions and compactors to safely clear the state.

entries.name: Zod-wrapped function helper
entries.description: `util/fn.ts` creates a wrapper over the callback, automatically validating the input via zod and providing `.force` to bypass the check. It is used by the Session and Share methods to combine type safety and direct calls.

entries.name: Lazy initializer
entries.description: `util/lazy.ts` memoizes the function result before the first call and returns the captured value. Similar lazy factories are used in the server and providers for lazy initialization of heavy dependencies.

entries.name: Readers-writer lock helper
entries.description: `util/lock.ts` implements reader-writer locking with writer priority: `Lock.read` And `Lock.write` queue promises, returning `Disposable` through `Symbol.dispose`, which frees up the slot and removes empty cards.

entries.name: Async queue iterable
entries.description: `util/queue.ts` provides `AsyncQueue`, combining a buffer and a waitlist: `push` first wakes up those waiting, `next` otherwise it returns a promise, and `Symbol.asyncIterator` infinite yield`it values, simplifying streaming pipelines without external brokers.

entries.name: Promise timeout guard
entries.description: `util/timeout.ts` wraps any promises in `Promise.race`: clears the timer after success and throws it away `Error("Operation timed out after ")`if a task does not complete on time, providing unified SLA control for network and file operations.

entries.name: Token count estimator
entries.description: `util/token.ts` approximates the number of tokens by dividing the string length by four and protecting against negative values, allowing early model limit checks in the CLI and runtime without external SDKs.

entries.name: Glob-style matcher
entries.description: `util/wildcard.ts` turns templates `*`/`?` into regular expressions, sorts sets by key length and returns the first matching value, allowing configurations and plugins to override behavior based on path and event masks.

entries.name: Windows preinstall shim
entries.description: `packages/opencode/script/preinstall.mjs` rewrites the package `bin` entry to point at `opencode.cmd` and removes the Unix shim on Windows, ensuring npm installs expose the correct launcher.

entries.name: Postinstall binary resolver
entries.description: `packages/opencode/script/postinstall.mjs` detects the host platform, resolves the right `opencode-<platform>-<arch>` package, recreates npm bin links (including a Windows npm rebuild) and symlinks the binary for non-Windows installs.

entries.name: LSP client session manager
entries.description: `LSPClient` (`packages/opencode/src/lsp/client.ts`) builds JSON-RPC connections, tracks diagnostics per file, emits events through the bus and ensures initialization completes within a timeout, enabling live feedback in CLI workflows.

entries.name: LSP server coordinator
entries.description: `LSP` (`packages/opencode/src/lsp/index.ts`) loads server definitions, applies config overrides, spawns processes, deduplicates clients per root and aggregates diagnostics and symbol lookups for downstream tools.

entries.name: Built-in LSP bootstrap
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/lsp/server.ts` defines LSP profiles for TypeScript, Vue, ESLint and Go, downloading language servers on demand into `Global.Path.bin` and spawning them with Bun's runtime wrapper so editor integrations work out of the box. Download policy is activated from commands `cli-run` and configurations `core-config-loader`. Downloaded language servers are reused `cli-run` and desktop editor `sdk-vscode-extension`. Component marked `lsp-backend` and interacts with runtime LSP tools.

entries.name: LSP language mapping
entries.description: `lsp/language.ts` lists extensions -> languageId (typescriptreact, shaderlab, etc.) so that the LSP client can correctly declare documents and receive diagnostics.

entries.name: TypeScript server bootstrap
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/lsp/server.ts` determined by the provider `Typescript`, which looks for lock files for the root, runs `typescript-language-server` through `BunProc.which()` and adds the path to `tsserver.js` V `initialization` data, providing a fully functional TS LSP without manual installation.

entries.name: Vue language server auto-install
entries.description: Chapter `Vue` V `lsp/server.ts` pulls up `@vue/language-server` V `Global.Path.bin` if there is no binary, mounts `vue-language-server.js` through `bun x` and includes `--stdio`so that the CLI will automatically serve `.vue` projects.

entries.name: VS Code ESLint bridge
entries.description: Block `ESLint` V `lsp/server.ts` downloads the repository `vscode-eslint`, installs npm dependencies, compiles the server and runs it via `bun --max-old-space-size=8192`, providing IDE-like lint diagnostics directly in opencode.

entries.name: Go language server installer
entries.description: `Gopls` V `lsp/server.ts` checks `GOBIN`, if there is no binary, it launches `go install golang.org/x/tools/gopls@latest` with output redirection to `Global.Path.bin` and returns managed `spawn`, connecting Go projects without manual configuration.

entries.name: Ruby LSP gem bootstrap
entries.description: `RubyLsp` block downloads `ruby-lsp` through `gem install --bindir Global.Path.bin`, adding support `.rb` files and fallback to the Ruby system, which allows the team to automatically enable Ruby diagnostics.

entries.name: Pyright virtualenv detector
entries.description: `Pyright` the provider collects possible `pythonPath` from `$VIRTUAL_ENV`, `.venv` And `venv`, adds it to `initialization`, and in the absence of a binary puts `pyright` V `Global.Path.bin`, ensuring Python interpreters are resolved correctly.

entries.name: ElixirLS release pipeline
entries.description: `ElixirLS` section downloads zip `elixir-ls`, collects release via `mix elixir_ls.release2` and runs the resulting binary, automatically resolving platform paths so that the CLI can index `.ex` projects.

entries.name: Zig language server downloader
entries.description: `Zls` implements archive selection by platform/architecture, downloads `zls-*.tar.xz|zip`, unpacks into `Global.Path.bin` and does `chmod +x`so that zls starts even without a system installation of the Zig server.

entries.name: csharp-ls dotnet installer
entries.description: `CSharp` the provider checks availability `.NET SDK`, performs `dotnet tool install csharp-ls --tool-path Global.Path.bin` and reuses the binary to enable C# support without global tools.

entries.name: Rust workspace root resolver
entries.description: `RustAnalyzer` finds `Cargo.toml`, rises to workspace `Cargo.toml`, controls the limit `Instance.worktree` and starts `rust-analyzer`, ensuring correct roots for multi-crate projects.

entries.name: Clangd release fetcher
entries.description: `Clangd` section calculates the name of the archive by platform, downloads the release from GitHub, extracts the binary and launches `clangd --background-index --clang-tidy`, adding C/C++ support without user downloads.

entries.name: Svelte language server loader
entries.description: `Svelte` provider downloads `svelte-language-server` to local `node_modules`, runs through `bun run --stdio` and returns empty init data so the CLI supports `.svelte` files out of the box.

entries.name: JDTLS launcher integration
entries.description: `JDTLS` implements Java 21 verification, downloads archive nightly `jdt-language-server`, looking for `org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_*.jar` and starts the server with a temporary dataDir to issue Java diagnostics without external configuration.

entries.name: Design system entrypoint
entries.description: `packages/css/src/index.css` collects cascades `@layer` (`theme`, `base`, `components`, `utilities`) so that console/web applications connect all tokens and styles in one line with a guaranteed order of overrides.

entries.name: Theme token registry
entries.description: `packages/css/src/theme.css` describes font, mesh, radius and surface variables, as well as light/dark palettes (`--surface-*`, `--text-*`) so that components reference common design tokens. The component is connected to `console-site` landing pages and workspace UI.

entries.name: Color palette variables
entries.description: `packages/css/src/color.css` fixes color series `smoke`, `yuzu`, `cobalt` along with alpha layers to `theme.css` and the components used a consistent palette. The component is connected to `console-site` landing pages and workspace UI.

entries.name: Reset & typography rules
entries.description: `packages/css/src/base.css` normalizes `box-sizing`, fonts, tables and lists using `--theme(...)` for fallback values, so that SSR/CSR clients start from the same base. The component is connected to `console-site` landing pages and workspace UI.

entries.name: Utility helpers
entries.description: `packages/css/src/utilities.css` adds utilities like `.no-scrollbar` And `interpolate-size`, allowing applications to hide scrollbars and smoothly animate sizes without local crutches. The component is connected to `console-site` landing pages and workspace UI.

entries.name: Button design tokens
entries.description: `packages/css/src/components/button.css` compares `data-variant` And `data-size` with tokens `--surface-*` And `--text-*`, providing consistent hover/focus states for all buttons. The component is connected to `console-site` landing pages and workspace UI.

entries.name: Icon layout rules
entries.description: `packages/css/src/components/icon.css` sets `display: inline-flex` And `flex-shrink: 0` For `data-component="icon"`so that SVG icons are centered and not compressed next to the text. The component is connected to `console-site` landing pages and workspace UI.

entries.name: Select dropdown styling
entries.description: `packages/css/src/components/select.css` draws up `data-component="select"`, animates the portal `select-open/close` and highlights `data-highlighted`so that the dropdown list looks the same on the web and console. The component is connected to `console-site` landing pages and workspace UI.

entries.name: Tabs surface styling
entries.description: `packages/css/src/components/tabs.css` builds `data-component="tabs"` from a flex container, hides the scrollbar and controls `data-selected`, forming an adaptive tab strip with common tokens. The component is connected to `console-site` landing pages and workspace UI.

entries.name: Component showcase app
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/ui/src/app.tsx` connects `@opencode-ai/css`, showcases buttons, selectors and tabs in a light/dark theme, providing a live showcase of a SolidJS design system. The component is connected to `console-site` landing pages and workspace UI.

entries.name: Solid entry renderer
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/ui/src/index.tsx` validates availability `#root` and calls `render(() => <App />)`, throwing a clear error in DEV and initializing the components stand. The component is connected to `console-site` landing pages and workspace UI.

entries.name: Solid button wrapper
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/ui/src/components/button.tsx` wraps `@kobalte/core/button`, sets `data-component="button"` and mapit `variant/size` V `data-*`, linking the JSX API with CSS tokens. The component is connected to `console-site` landing pages and workspace UI.

entries.name: Grouped select component
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/ui/src/components/select.tsx` builds Kobalte Select with `groupBy`, `data-slot` sections and a Button-based trigger, providing a type-safe drop-down list for the console. The component is connected to `console-site` landing pages and workspace UI.

entries.name: Tabs compound component
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/ui/src/components/tabs.tsx` compiles Kobalte Tabs into a compound API (`Tabs.List`, `Tabs.Trigger`, `Tabs.Content`), assigning `data-slot` and combining classes for CSS compatibility. The component is connected to `console-site` landing pages and workspace UI.

entries.name: Inline icon registry
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/ui/src/components/icon.tsx` stores SVG templates in `icons` and renders them through `dangerouslySetInnerHTML`so that buttons and selectors receive consistent icons. The component is connected to `console-site` landing pages and workspace UI.

entries.name: Component barrel
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/ui/src/components/index.ts` re-exports Button/Icon/Select/Tabs as a single module so that consumers import the design system via `@opencode-ai/ui` without nested paths. The component is connected to `console-site` landing pages and workspace UI.

entries.name: Global Geist font injection
entries.description: `ui/src/components/fonts.tsx` registers Geist variable fonts and fallback metrics through `<Style>` blocks and preload links, making the shared UI kit reuse consistent typography across web and desktop surfaces.

entries.name: Accessible tooltip wrapper
entries.description: `ui/src/components/tooltip.tsx` wraps Kobalte tooltips, wiring focus listeners to open state and rendering arrowed portals, so any component can attach deterministic hover/focus help in Solid.

entries.name: Theme variable generator script
entries.description: `css/script/colors.ts` reads the curated color list and emits `@theme` CSS variables, keeping Tailwind tokens in sync with design tokens via a Bun script.

entries.name: UI package Vite setup
entries.description: `packages/ui/vite.config.ts` runs the Solid plugin with ESNext output and dedicated dev port, enabling the shared component library to build both ESM bundles and story sandboxes.

entries.name: TUI bootstrap command
entries.description: `cli/cmd/tui.ts` prepares the working directory, raises the local API via `Server.listen`, selects a model/agent, pulls the built-in TUI binary (or builds Go), and also triggers autologin/auto-update/IDE installation via `Bus` And `Installation`. Bootstrap calls `tui-app-core`, relies on `cli-bootstrap` And `runtime/server-core`. Associated with `cli-bootstrap`, `tui-app-core` and headless `cli-serve`.

entries.name: CLI attach bridge
entries.description: `cli/cmd/attach.ts` extracts the built-in TUI binary into `${Global.Path.cache}/tui`, rebuilds it from Go sources in the absence of an artifact and runs it with `OPENCODE_SERVER=<url>`holding up the flag `--session` to continue remote sessions. The command connects to the running `cli-serve` and shares the protocol with `server-tui-bridge`. The command connects local `cli-serve` through `server-tui-bridge` And `tui-app-entrypoint`.

entries.name: Escape sequence parser
entries.description: `input/parse.go` detects compatibility flags (Ctrl+Space/@, Tab/Ctrl+I, etc.), recognizes CSI/SS3/OSC/DCS, Kitty extensions and SGR mouse, returning `UnknownEvent` for broken sequences and supporting alt-modifier decoding.

entries.name: Go input reader
entries.description: `packages/tui/input/driver.go` And `input.go` implement `Reader`which reads stdin via `cancelreader`, glues partial ESC sequences, transfers events to the key table and beats bracketed paste into one `PasteEvent`, simultaneously collapsing mouse wheel/motion event bursts.

entries.name: ServerTUI bridge
entries.description: `server/tui.ts` creates a request/response queue (`AsyncQueue`) and route `/next`/`/response`so that the binary TUI on the remote client can receive API requests from the CLI and return responses without a direct WebSocket connection. Bridge uses `runtime-tools/util-queue`, serves `cli-attach-tui` And `tui-app-core`. Bridge in use `cli-attach-tui`, `tui-app-entrypoint` And `cli-serve`.

entries.name: Win32 event handler
entries.description: `input/driver_windows.go` uses Windows Console API: pre `peek`-reads `InputRecord`, unpacks key/mouse/resize/focus events into generic types and keeps track of recent states, and read undo works via `CancelIoEx`.

entries.name: Key catalog & tables
entries.description: `input/key.go` And `table.go` describe the full set of codes (F1-F63, keypad, media, modifiers) and build tables of terminal sequences for different flags. This is a source of plausible `KeyPressEvent` in the parser.

entries.name: Console cancel reader
entries.description: `input/cancelreader_windows.go` configures console flags (`ENABLE_WINDOW_INPUT`, `ENABLE_MOUSE_INPUT`), resets the buffer and implements `CancelReader` on top `CancelIoEx`, returning the mode when closing. On Unix `cancelreader_other.go` delegates to the standard implementation.

entries.name: Kitty protocol support
entries.description: `input/kitty.go` decodes progressive kitty-enhancements, graphics events and specific keycodes, converting them to local ones `Key` structures and modifiers. This allows TUI to work correctly in Kitty/WezTerm and similar clients.

entries.name: Mouse event model
entries.description: `input/mouse.go` describes `Mouse` and derived events (click/release/wheel/motion), parses SGR sequences and matches ctrl/alt/shift modifiers to codes. Thanks to this, TUI receives unified coordinate and button structures.

entries.name: Clipboard & paste events
entries.description: `input/clipboard.go` And `paste.go` describe OSC52 `ClipboardEvent`, samples (system/primary) and bracketed input (`PasteStart/End`). Reader aggregates bytes into one `PasteEvent`, providing format input transfer to the TUI. Clipboard shares implementation with `tui-clipboard-core` and is called `cli-tui` when passing a buffer to TUI. The handler shares code with `tui-clipboard-core` and is called `tool-guide-read` when inserting patches. Uses `tui-clipboard-core`, `tui-components/textarea` And `tool-guide-read` for inserts. Also marked `terminal-bridge` And `terminal-clipboard` with CLI/automation.

entries.name: Mode reporting events
entries.description: `input/mode.go` enters `ModeReportEvent` for DECRPM, storing the mode number and value from the ANSI sequence. These messages allow TUI to keep track of enabled terminal modes.

entries.name: Focus & cursor events
entries.description: `input/focus.go` And `cursor.go` describe `FocusEvent`/`BlurEvent` And `CursorPositionEvent`, normalizing coordinate-types and helping the TUI respond to focus changes and cursor requests.

entries.name: Terminal color events
entries.description: `input/color.go` defines events `ForegroundColorEvent`/`BackgroundColorEvent`/`CursorColorEvent`, converts RGBA to hex, calculates brightness via HSL and allows TUI to accept the response `ansi.Request*Color`, adjusting the theme to the terminal.

entries.name: Primary device attributes parser
entries.description: `input/da1.go` parses the response to ESC[0c, pulling parameters from `ansi.Params` to array `PrimaryDeviceAttributesEvent`so that TUI knows the capabilities of the terminal before enabling advanced modes.

entries.name: Key modifier bitmask
entries.description: `input/mod.go` describes bitmasks of XTerm/Kitty keyboard modifiers (`Shift|Alt|Ctrl|Meta|Hyper|Super`) and method `Contains`, unifying hotkey handling for CLI and TUI. Combinations are used `cli-tui` and hotkey-overlay tools.

entries.name: Termcap capability decoder
entries.description: `input/termcap.go` converts responses to XTGETTCAP: decodes hex pairs `name=value`, collects them in `CapabilityEvent` and filters out empty entries, allowing the engine to match terminal capabilities.

entries.name: Terminfo key mapping
entries.description: `input/terminfo.go` builds a combination table: loads `terminfo` By `TERM`, combines standard and extended capabilities and matches them with `Key` codes (including modifications of F-keys) so that TUI receives the same events on different terminals.

entries.name: XTerm modifyOtherKeys handler
entries.description: `input/xterm.go` parses ESC[27;<mod>;<code>~ sequences and returns `KeyPressEvent` with modifiers, including special Backspace/Tab/Enter/Escape keys, which makes modifyOtherKeys 1/2 modes supported.

entries.name: Non-Windows input driver stub
entries.description: `input/driver_other.go` implements `Reader.ReadEvents` through a common `readEvents()` and disables the Win32 parser as unnecessary, ensuring correct assembly on Unix and cleaning up conditional compilation. Turns on `cli-tui` when starting on Unix terminals.

entries.name: TUI CLI entrypoint
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/cmd/opencode/main.go` boots the Bubble Tea program: it normalizes stdin prompts, fetches agents/projects via the Go SDK, streams server events into the UI, and wires clipboard initialization plus signal handling before handing control to the TUI model. The entry point calls `cli-tui`, `tui-app-core` and renders `tui-components/root`. Routed as `terminal-bridge`: causes `cli-attach-tui` And `server-tui-bridge`.

entries.name: TUI control request pump
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/api/api.go` loops on `/tui/control/next`, forwarding remote control envelopes into the Bubble Tea program and offering a `Reply` helper that posts results back to the opencode API. Gateway over `server-tui-bridge` sends requests to `runtime-tools/tool-*`.

entries.name: App state bootstrapper
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/app/app.go` hydrates config, loads persisted theme/session state, picks initial agent/model, seeds command registry and message history, and exposes helpers for cycling agents, models, and permissions. Core is used `cli-tui`, `tui-components/*` And `tool-guide-*` to build the UI. Part of the chain `terminal-bridge`, which combines CLI and TUI.

entries.name: Persistent TUI state store
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/app/state.go` serialises theme choice, model usage history, agent recency and message log into TOML, offering helpers to rotate recents and restore attachment sources on load. The state is synchronized with `runtime/session-lifecycle`, `cli-serve` and workspace share.

entries.name: Prompt  message bridge
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/app/prompt.go` converts editor prompts with attachments into opencode message/part unions, handling inline text replacements, file metadata, agent inserts, and reversible history snapshots.

entries.name: Attachment type system
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/attachment/attachment.go` defines the typed attachment model (text/file/symbol/agent), map serializers, and UUID generation that keep prompt annotations round-trippable across state loads.

entries.name: Command & keybinding registry
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/commands/command.go` builds the modal command catalog with priority sorting, leader-aware key matches, slash triggers, and helpers for dispatching macro sequences. The registry reads `cli-command-catalog`, `tool-guide-*` and connects to `runtime-tools/tool-registry`. Registry is included in `workflow-config`, synchronizing CLI and TUI commands.

entries.name: Agent completion provider
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/completions/agents.go` queries the opencode API for secondary agents, filters by query text, and decorates entries with themed labels for the completion palette. Login `prompt-builder`, serving CLI/TUI prompts. The component reads `model-catalog` to display agents.

entries.name: Slash command completions
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/completions/commands.go` ranks command triggers using fuzzy matching, aligns descriptions with lipgloss spacing, and returns completion suggestions keyed by command name. The module uses `cli-generate`, `tool-guide-task` and runtime completions. The team uses `terminal-bridge` between CLI generation and TUI list.

entries.name: File completion aggregator
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/completions/files.go` combines git status rankings with server-side Find queries to surface candidate file paths for command prompts, preserving modification counts and caching in the background.

entries.name: Chat editor engine
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/components/chat/editor.go` manages the textarea, command history navigation, attachment insertion via clipboard or files, and handles Bash submit mode toggles. The editor uses `tui-components/textarea`, `runtime-tools/tool-edit` And `tool-guide-edit`.

entries.name: Message viewport renderer
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/components/chat/messages.go` virtualises rendered messages, handles selection copying, tool detail toggles, shimmer animations, and scroll shortcuts across the session transcript. Messages are built on top `session/message-v2`, `tui-components/chat-message` and share sync.

entries.name: Session switcher dialog
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/components/dialog/session.go` renders the session picker, supports rename/delete flows with confirmations, spins API calls to load or remove sessions, and updates the modal title dynamically.

entries.name: Theme selection modal
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/components/dialog/theme.go` lists available themes, previews them live, and reverts to the original palette when the dialog closes without confirmation.

entries.name: Status bar & git watcher
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/components/status/status.go` renders the opencode logo, cwd collapse, agent badge, and watches the git branch via fsnotify to refresh the banner when refs change. Status displays data `tool-guide-stats`, `cli-stats-display` and usage API.

entries.name: Toast notification manager
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/components/toast/toast.go` manages timed notifications, renders them as overlays with adaptive colors, and schedules dismissals via Tea ticks. Toasts display results `cli-commands`, errors `runtime-tools` and console events. The component is included in `tui-shell-ui`, working with overlay `tui-component-modal`.

entries.name: Theme registry manager
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/theme/manager.go` keeps the active theme, caches ANSI colour usage, sorts available themes, and applies system background overrides when terminals disclose palette data.

entries.name: Theme JSON loader
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/theme/loader.go` embeds default theme JSON, loads overrides from user and project directories in priority order, and resolves colour definitions before registering them.

entries.name: API slog handler
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/util/apilogger.go` implements a buffered slog handler that streams structured logs to the opencode App Log endpoint on a background goroutine with sanitized attributes. Marked `tui-logging`, forwarding events to App Log.

entries.name: File preview renderer
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/util/file.go` tracks root/cwd paths, truncates content, wraps code fences, and runs markdown rendering while preserving relative paths for TUI previews.

entries.name: Concurrent map helpers
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/util/concurrency.go` provides `mapParallel` and `WriteStringsPar` so view rendering can map work in goroutines but emit ordered output. The assistant applies `runtime-tools/util-queue` and events `server-tui-bridge`.

entries.name: Viewport model
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/viewport/viewport.go` implements the scrollable viewport with memoised rendering, gutter hooks, soft wrap control, and directional key maps for the chat transcript. Viewport is built on `tui-foundation-viewport-*` and picks it up `tool-guide-read` diffs. Viewport is tagged `tui-shell-ui` and shares behavior with `tui-components` modal windows.

entries.name: Root TUI model
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/tui/tui.go` composes editor, messages, dialogs, completions, toast manager, and debounced exit/interrupt states into the top-level Bubble Tea model. Root links `tui-app-state`, `cli-run` events and `tui-components` render.

entries.name: Anthropic Sept 2025 guardrails
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/session/prompt/anthropic-20250930.txt` forces Anthropic runs to stay defensive, route Claude Code questions through WebFetch, keep replies under four lines, and rely on TodoWrite planning before any tool work.

entries.name: Anthropic concise response prompt
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/session/prompt/anthropic.txt` keeps Anthropic sessions terse by banning preambles, insisting on direct one-line answers when possible, and reminding the agent to explain any non-trivial bash commands to the user first.

entries.name: Anthropic spoof identity tag
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/session/prompt/anthropic_spoof.txt` pins the persona to "Claude Code", ensuring external hosts treat the CLI session as Anthropic's official agent when spoof mode is required.

entries.name: Beast autonomous workflow
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/session/prompt/beast.txt` drives the "beast mode" persona: it mandates exhaustive tool planning, recursive WebFetch research, todo tracking, and forbids yielding before every checklist item and test is finished.

entries.name: Build mode activation reminder
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/session/prompt/build-switch.txt` emits a system reminder that the agent has left plan-mode and may now modify files, clarifying capability changes for downstream automations.

entries.name: Custom agent blueprint prompt
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/agent/generate.txt` guides the agent-architect persona to craft JSON definitions with identifiers, use-case examples, and rich system prompts that align with CLAUDE.md project context.

entries.name: Codex CLI operating charter
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/session/prompt/codex.txt` codifies Codex CLI etiquettepreamble requirements, plan tool usage, sandbox expectations, testing philosophy, and output formattingso every run behaves like the open-source harness expects.

entries.name: Copilot GPT-5 workflow script
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/session/prompt/copilot-gpt-5.txt` programs Copilot sessions to stay impersonal, honor todo-driven planning, fetch external references via WebFetch, and avoid echoing tool logs while maintaining upbeat communication guidelines.

entries.name: Gemini compliance prompt
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/session/prompt/gemini.txt` enforces Gemini sessions to respect project conventions, verify dependency usage, resolve all file paths absolutely, and handle workflow steps with proactive verification before acting.

entries.name: Repository bootstrap briefing
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/session/prompt/initialize.txt` is the onboarding script that tells new agents to inspect the codebase, catalogue build and formatting rules, and capture them in `AGENTS.md` when no guidance exists.

entries.name: Plan-mode safety lock
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/session/prompt/plan.txt` emits the read-only guardrail that forbids any write operations while in plan mode, overriding user edit requests until build mode resumes.

entries.name: Qwen secure operations prompt
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/session/prompt/qwen.txt` keeps Qwen runs laser-focused: refuse malware work, answer in under four lines, explain impactful bash commands, and route opencode product questions through WebFetch documentation.

entries.name: Conversation summary primer
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/session/prompt/summarize.txt` instructs the summarizer persona to capture accomplishments, active work, edited files, and next steps so hand-offs stay actionable.

entries.name: Thread title generator
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/session/prompt/title.txt` constrains the title agent to emit a single <=50 character gerund-based summary with preserved technical nouns and no auxiliary chatter.

entries.name: Bash tool safety contract
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/tool/bash.txt` lays out Bash guardrails: verify directories with List, quote paths, batch git hygiene commands, respect timeouts, and avoid raw grep/find in favor of opencode search tools.

entries.name: Edit tool exact-match rules
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/tool/edit.txt` demands a prior Read, exact `oldString` matches, replace-all for renames, and rejects ambiguous replacements so edits stay deterministic.

entries.name: Glob pattern search tips
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/tool/glob.txt` positions Glob as the fast filename matcher, recommending batched searches and deferring long exploratory hunts to the Task tool.

entries.name: Grep usage guidance
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/tool/grep.txt` frames Grep as the regex content scanner, warns to use Bash+`rg` for counts, and nudges long discovery workflows toward Task agents.

entries.name: List tool absolute paths
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/tool/ls.txt` reminds the agent that List requires absolute paths and should yield to Glob/Grep when targeted discovery is possible.

entries.name: LSP diagnostics blocker
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/tool/lsp-diagnostics.txt` is an explicit DO-NOT-USE flag, preventing accidental invocation of the disabled diagnostics endpoint. Guide describes the set `lsp-backend` tools.

entries.name: LSP hover disabled notice
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/tool/lsp-hover.txt` records that the hover helper is intentionally unavailable so agents don't rely on it. Guide describes the set `lsp-backend` tools.

entries.name: Multiedit atomic operations
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/tool/multiedit.txt` explains batching multiple replacements into one atomic transaction, inheriting Edit's exact-match rules while sequencing edits safely.

entries.name: Patch tool prohibition
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/tool/patch.txt` simply marks the legacy Patch tool as off-limits, steering edits toward Edit or Multiedit.

entries.name: Read tool parameters
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/tool/read.txt` documents the cat-style reader: absolute paths, 2000-line windows, batching multiple reads, and the system reminder for empty files. The guide describes `terminal-clipboard` insertions and work with TUI.

entries.name: Task agent orchestrator
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/tool/task.txt` launching explains sub-agents, when to prefer targeted tools, and how to structure prompts so autonomous agents return actionable summaries. Supports the family `cli-templates` for CLI and TUI workflows.

entries.name: TodoRead cadence
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/tool/todoread.txt` urges frequent todo reviews, outlines ideal checkpoints, and reminds that the tool takes no parameters. Supports the family `cli-templates` for CLI and TUI workflows.

entries.name: TodoWrite planning rules
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/tool/todowrite.txt` spells out when to build todo lists, how to manage states, and cautions against trivial single-step checklists. Supports the family `cli-templates` for CLI and TUI workflows.

entries.name: WebFetch content retriever
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/tool/webfetch.txt` covers prompt-driven HTTP fetches, markdown conversion, cache behavior, and when to favor specialized fetch tools.

entries.name: WebSearch capability overview
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/tool/websearch.txt` explains the US-only web search endpoint, its formatted result blocks, and domain filtering options for fresh knowledge.

entries.name: Write tool overwrite guardrails
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/opencode/src/tool/write.txt` warns that Write overwrites files, demands a preceding Read, and forbids unsolicited documentation creation.

entries.name: Reusable list widget
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/components/list/list.go` builds a generic list model with configurable render/select handlers, j/k keybindings and wrap-around navigation that every modal (agents, models, timeline) reuses for consistent selection UX.

entries.name: Commands palette renderer
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/components/commands/commands.go` formats `/trigger` rows from `app.Commands`, merges VS Code key hints, and lays them out with lipgloss so help dialogs and overlays share the same command listing logic.

entries.name: Agent picker dialog
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/components/dialog/agents.go` layers a `SearchDialog` over recent and built-in agents, fuzzy ranks names, and emits `app.AgentSelectedMsg` while persisting recents in `State.AgentModel`.

entries.name: Model selection dialog
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/components/dialog/models.go` enumerates provider models via the Go SDK, keeps a recent list in `State.RecentlyUsedModels`, and dispatches `app.ModelSelectedMsg` when the user swaps providers inside the TUI.

entries.name: Completion dropdown orchestrator
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/components/dialog/complete.go` multiplexes completion providers, fuzzy ranks results per provider, and turns Tab/Enter keys into `CompletionSelectedMsg` inserts for the chat editor.

entries.name: Help modal viewport
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/components/dialog/help.go` wraps the commands component in a scrollable viewport and a modal frame, giving the TUI help overlay consistent sizing and theme behaviour.

entries.name: Search dialog scaffold
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/components/dialog/search.go` binds a textinput to the reusable list, emitting `SearchSelectionMsg`, `SearchQueryChangedMsg`, and `SearchRemoveItemMsg` so agent/model pickers share identical input UX.

entries.name: Session timeline list
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/components/dialog/timeline.go` builds a timeline of user prompts with timestamps and tool counts, firing `ScrollToMessageMsg` and `RestoreToMessageMsg` when operators jump around a session.

entries.name: Modal frame renderer
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/components/modal/modal.go` centers dialog content, draws borders via `layout.PlaceOverlay`, and decorates titles with ESC hints to standardize every popup. Involved in the set `tui-shell-ui` for terminal UI.

entries.name: QR code renderer
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/components/qr/qr.go` encodes strings with `rsc.io/qr` and maps pairs of pixels into Unicode half-blocks using theme colors so share links can be scanned in the terminal.

entries.name: Chat render cache
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/components/chat/cache.go` stores rendered message fragments behind a FNV64 hash so expensive lipgloss rendering can be reused while scrolling.

entries.name: Message block renderer
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/components/chat/message.go` composes lipgloss blocks, diff previews and tool annotations for each message, honouring theme colours and utilising `diff` helpers for inline highlights.

entries.name: Textarea editor engine
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/components/textarea/textarea.go` (with `memoization.go` and `runeutil.go`) powers the chat input, handling cursor math, rune segmentation, memoised layout and scroll-lock for multi-line prompts. Involved in the set `tui-shell-ui` for terminal UI.

entries.name: Diff rendering pipeline
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/components/diff/diff.go` and `parse.go` parse unified patches, compute intra-line segments, and emit side-by-side or unified views with Chroma syntax colors for tool previews.

entries.name: Completion provider protocol
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/completions/provider.go` and `suggestion.go` define the provider interface and rich suggestion payload (display formatter, raw data, provider ID) that the dialogs consume.

entries.name: Symbol completion provider
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/completions/symbols.go` queries `Find.Symbols`, formats URIs with theme colours, and returns suggestions keyed by range parameters so completions can jump to file positions.

entries.name: Ascending ID generator
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/id/id.go` produces timestamp-prefixed IDs (ses/msg/usr/prt) with counter and descending variants, ensuring deterministic ordering for cached session data.

entries.name: Layout globals
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/layout/layout.go` tracks current viewport/container dimensions and exposes the `Modal` interface so components can consistently render overlays.

entries.name: Flexbox renderer
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/layout/flex.go` emulates flexbox-style layout (direction, justify, align, gap) to assemble lipgloss views for status bars and command lists.

entries.name: Overlay compositor
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/layout/overlay.go` slices ANSI-safe lines, preserves styles, and optionally draws borders when overlaying modal content onto the background grid.

entries.name: Markdown renderer theme
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/styles/markdown.go` builds glamour style configs from the active theme, wiring adaptive colours into headings, code blocks and syntax highlighting.

entries.name: Adaptive style helpers
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/styles/utilities.go` wraps lipgloss styles to respect "no color" values and provides `NewStyle`, `WhitespaceStyle`, and color-safe border setters used throughout the TUI.

entries.name: Theme interface & base
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/theme/theme.go` defines the `Theme` contract and the reusable `BaseTheme` struct that concrete themes embed to expose adaptive colours across the UI.

entries.name: Dynamic system theme
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/theme/system.go` derives a palette from the terminal background, updating diff, markdown and status colours when the environment reports light/dark modes.

entries.name: ANSI colour downgrade
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/util/color.go` converts 24-bit CSI sequences into ANSI-16 equivalents and maps agent indices to theme colours so logs remain readable on limited terminals.

entries.name: IDE detection helpers
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/util/ide.go` inspects environment variables to identify VS Code, Cursor or Windsurf callers so the TUI can surface IDE-specific shortcuts.

entries.name: Shimmer text effect
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/util/shimmer.go` animates loading text with time-based gradients, falling back to ANSI 16-colour capsules when true-colour is unavailable.

entries.name: Utility helpers
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/util/util.go` offers `CmdHandler`, `Clamp`, `IsWsl`, and timing helpers that other TUI subsystems lean on for messaging and environment detection.

entries.name: Viewport highlight parser
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/viewport/highlight.go` converts byte-range matches into grapheme-safe highlight ranges, accounting for ANSI escapes so search hits render correctly.

entries.name: Viewport key bindings
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/tui/internal/viewport/keymap.go` defines the pager keymap (PgUp/PgDn, half-page, vim arrows) reused by the viewport model and chat transcript.

entries.name: Clipboard core API
entries.description: `internal/clipboard/clipboard.go` And `clipboard_nocgo.go` provide cross-platform API: `Init` initializes the implementation, the global mutex serializes operations, `Write` returns the change channel, `Watch` provides updates, and without CGO all functions crash.

entries.name: Linux clipboard backends
entries.description: `internal/clipboard/clipboard_linux.go` selects xclip/xsel/wl-copy by environment, checks for the presence of utilities via `which`, logs warnings and generates detailed installation instructions, ensuring copy/paste works in X11 and Wayland.

entries.name: Adaptive whitespace style
entries.description: `internal/styles/styles.go` exports `WhitespaceStyle`creating lipgloss whitespace with adaptive color via `compat.AdaptiveColor`so that TUI components can color placeholders in light and dark themes. Applied by components `tui-components` and rendering `terminal-render`.

entries.name: TUI input package overview
entries.description: `packages/tui/input/doc.go` documents the terminal input utilities, clarifying that the Go package handles escape parsing, clipboard and driver customization for the Bubble Tea frontend.

entries.name: macOS clipboard bridge
entries.description: `internal/clipboard/clipboard_darwin.go` shells out to AppleScript to read/write text and image data, tracks change counters and retries updates, enabling the TUI to sync with the macOS clipboard.

entries.name: Windows clipboard implementation
entries.description: `internal/clipboard/clipboard_windows.go` uses Win32 APIs to read/write Unicode text and DIB images, converts BMP payloads to PNG and handles retries, giving the TUI native clipboard support on Windows.

entries.name: Auth callback session
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/console/app/src/routes/auth/callback.ts` exchanges the OpenAuth code grant, decodes the returned subject and stores the account in the persisted auth session before redirecting back to `/auth`.

entries.name: Auth actor context
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/console/app/src/context/auth.ts` wraps the OpenAuth client, resolves the current actor from the session and upgrades requests into `Actor` scoped database calls, ensuring every route executes with the correct workspace/user identity.

entries.name: Auth session persistence
entries.description: `packages/console/app/src/context/auth.session.ts` creates Solid `useSession` c cookie `auth`, encrypts accounts, stores `current` workspace and configures a one-year TTL so that the web console will restore the selected user between requests.

entries.name: withActor bridge
entries.description: `context/auth.withActor.ts` wraps SolidStart routes by calling `getActor` and publishing `Actor.provide`so that server actions and drizzle requests automatically receive the rights of the current workspace.

entries.name: Console actor context
entries.description: `core/src/actor.ts` describes actor types`ov (public/account/user/system), logs context provision, gives `Actor.assert/Actor.workspace/Actor.account` And `assertAdmin`, associating server actions with the current user.

entries.name: Auth authorize redirect
entries.description: `routes/auth/authorize.ts` builds the console callback with `new URL('./callback', request.url)` and hands it to `AuthClient.authorize(..., 'code')`, returning `Response.redirect` so every login round-trip starts inside the OpenAuth issuer without exposing the console host details.

entries.name: Account workspace redirector
entries.description: `routes/auth/index.ts` wraps `withActor` to assert an account actor, looks up undeleted workspace memberships via Drizzle joins on `UserTable` and `WorkspaceTable`, and 302-redirects to the first workspace or back to `/auth/authorize` when nothing is linked.

entries.name: Monthly spend limiter
entries.description: `monthly-limit-section.tsx` pulls `Billing.get()` and through the form `setMonthlyLimit` checks for negative values, refocuses the input according to `Show`, and redraws monthly spending usage after each send.

entries.name: Workspace billing page gating
entries.description: `routes/workspace/[id]/billing/index.tsx` causes `querySessionInfo` and shows Billing, MonthlyLimit and Payment sections only for `userInfo()?.isAdmin`, so non-admins never see the payment form.

entries.name: Stripe checkout and reload controls
entries.description: `billing-section.tsx` raises Solid `action` For `Billing.reload`, `Billing.generateSessionUrl` And `Billing.get`, synchronizes `setReload` With `BillingTable` and through `createCheckoutUrlAction` leads the admin in Stripe, validating the balance and auto-replenishment errors on the UI.

entries.name: Stripe payments table with receipt links
entries.description: `payment-section.tsx` requests `Billing.payments()`, displays dates through `formatDateForTable` and when clicked it calls `Billing.generateReceiptUrl`by opening Stripe receipt in a new tab.

entries.name: Workspace helpers for checkout and billing
entries.description: `routes/workspace/common.tsx` through `withActor` provides `querySessionInfo`, `queryBillingInfo` And `createCheckoutUrl`, checks admin rights and calls `Billing.generateCheckoutUrl` for redirects in Stripe.

entries.name: Usage history table
entries.description: `usage-section.tsx` builds a table by `Billing.usages()`, outputs tokens and cost in dollars and uses `formatDateForTable`/`formatDateUTC` for hints in hover.

entries.name: Stripe webhook dispatcher
entries.description: `routes/stripe/webhook.ts` verifies events with `Billing.stripe().webhooks.constructEventAsync`, updates customer metadata, records payments and refunds in `BillingTable`/`PaymentTable`, and toggles reload flags so Stripe state stays in sync with console billing.

entries.name: Billing controls styling
entries.description: `billing/billing-section.module.css` shapes the reload error alert, payment summary card and button rows, stretching Stripe actions on small screens.

entries.name: Monthly limit card styling
entries.description: `billing/monthly-limit-section.module.css` formats the spend card, currency typography and form errors while keeping update buttons aligned on mobile.

entries.name: Payment history table styling
entries.description: `billing/payment-section.module.css` sets table typography, hides the payment ID column on mobile and strikes through refunded amounts for clarity.

entries.name: Usage table styling
entries.description: `usage-section.module.css` provides the dashed empty state, scrollable usage table and responsive column hiding that power billing usage reporting.

entries.name: User menu logout
entries.description: `routes/user-menu.tsx` displays a drop-down menu, resets the current account via `useAuthSession().update` and forces redirect to `/zen`, allowing you to switch workspace users without restarting the application.

entries.name: Workspace layout shell
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/console/app/src/routes/workspace.tsx` renders the console workspace chrome with header branding, async user email lookup and a `WorkspacePicker`, framing every workspace view with consistent navigation.

entries.name: Workspace nav gating
entries.description: `routes/workspace/[id].tsx` builds a layout with Zen/Keys/Members tabs and hides Billing/Settings behind `userInfo()?.isAdmin`, which keeps administrative sections only for workspace owners.

entries.name: Workspace picker modal
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/console/app/src/routes/workspace-picker.tsx` loads available workspaces via server-side drizzle queries, shows a dropdown with server actions to create new workspaces and redirects to the selected workspace slug.

entries.name: Zen workspace header with billing CTA
entries.description: `workspace/[id]/index.tsx` calculates balance through `createMemo`, gives admins a button `createCheckoutUrlAction` and collects Zen, models, providers and usage sections in one dashboard.

entries.name: First-run onboarding banner
entries.description: `new-user-section.tsx` checks `Key.list()` And `Billing.usages()` and, if there is only one key and there is no usage, it shows instructions, highlights the default key and allows you to copy it with a button.

entries.name: Model toggles backed by Zen secret
entries.description: `model-section.tsx` unpacks `ZenModel.list()` from secret `ZEN_MODELS`, sorts the models, and `updateModel` enables/disables access via `Model.disable`/`Model.enable`, allowing only administrators to switch.

entries.name: Bring-your-own key management
entries.description: `provider-section.tsx` displays OpenAI/Anthropic providers, masks keys, calls `Provider.create`/`Provider.remove` and keeps separate `useSubmission` for inline validation.

entries.name: Workspace API key lifecycle
entries.description: `key-section.tsx` pulls `Key.list()` through `listKeys`, creates keys for the current user, hides other people's values and provides copying to the buffer with feedback for 1 second.

entries.name: Member invite and role editor
entries.description: `member-section.tsx` wraps `User.list/update/remove` And `User.invite`, monitors roles through `RoleDropdown` and does not allow you to edit yourself, refreshing data through `listMembers`.

entries.name: Workspace settings rename form
entries.description: `settings-section.tsx` requests `WorkspaceTable` through `getWorkspaceInfo`, gives an inline form `updateWorkspace` and validates the name length before calling `Workspace.update`.

entries.name: 404 marketing fallback
entries.description: `routes/[...404].tsx` renders a themed 404 page with `Title`, `HttpStatusCode`, light/dark logos and primary navigation links (Docs, GitHub, Discord) so marketing traffic lands on a branded recovery screen instead of a blank error.

entries.name: Discord redirect route
entries.description: `routes/discord.ts` handles GET requests by returning `redirect('https://discord.gg/opencode')`, centralising the invite link so the marketing site and console share one canonical endpoint.

entries.name: Docs short-link proxy
entries.description: `routes/s/[id].ts` clones the incoming request and forwards every HTTP verb to `https://docs.opencode.ai/docs...`, acting as a transparent short-link proxy for shared documentation URLs.

entries.name: Interactive landing hero
entries.description: `routes/temp.tsx` wires CTA links, clipboard copy handlers and showcase sections (features, installers, screenshots) into the Solid marketing page so the `/temp` landing acts as a full hero experiment without separate JS.

entries.name: Workspace keys child route
entries.description: `routes/workspace/[id]/keys/index.tsx` mounts `<KeySection />` inside the shared `data-page=workspace-[id]`/`data-slot=sections` scaffold so keys inherit the workspace chrome and analytics decorators.

entries.name: Workspace members child route
entries.description: `routes/workspace/[id]/members/index.tsx` renders `<MemberSection />` within the standard workspace layout container so membership management slots into the existing chrome.

entries.name: Workspace settings child route
entries.description: `routes/workspace/[id]/settings/index.tsx` wraps `<SettingsSection />` in the shared `data-slot=sections` container so domain and slug settings reuse the workspace scaffolding.

entries.name: Solid Start document shell
entries.description: `entry-server.tsx` configures `createHandler`/`StartServer` with `mode: 'async'`, injecting favicons, social meta tags and the app container so SSR output matches the console branding before hydration.

entries.name: Solid client bootstrapper
entries.description: `entry-client.tsx` hydrates the console UI by mounting `<StartClient />` into `#app`, bridging SSR output with the Solid Start client runtime.

entries.name: Legal footer component
entries.description: `component/legal.tsx` renders the  notice with the current year and links to Anomaly, giving marketing and console shells a shared legal footer snippet.

entries.name: Universal console reset
entries.description: `style/reset.css` resets box-sizing and default margins, enables motion-safe `interpolate-size` and isolates `#root` so SolidStart pages share an accessible baseline across browsers.

entries.name: Base typography and sr-only helpers
entries.description: `style/base.css` pins the shell background to `--color-bg`, applies the IBM Plex stack via `--font-sans` and ships the `.sr-only` utility used across console header and navigation.

entries.name: Console color token registry
entries.description: `style/token/color.css` defines light/dark `--color-*` variables for surfaces, text, buttons and danger states, keeping workspace buttons, tables and alerts visually consistent.

entries.name: Spacing scale for workspace UI
entries.description: `style/token/space.css` publishes the console spacing system (`--space-0`  `--space-96`) plus shared border radii, letting section layouts and dropdowns align on the same rhythm.

entries.name: Font scale and IBM Plex mapping
entries.description: `style/token/font.css` sets the size ladder from `--font-size-2xs` to `--font-size-9xl` and maps both sans and mono families to IBM Plex Mono for the console shell.

entries.name: Workspace frame layout styles
entries.description: `routes/workspace/[id].css` drives the two-column layout with a sticky header, 240px nav, responsive section stack and header/billing slots via `[data-component]` selectors.

entries.name: Workspace header chrome
entries.description: `routes/workspace.css` styles shared buttons, sticky header brand/actions slots and hover/disabled states so every workspace child route inherits consistent chrome.

entries.name: Workspace picker dropdown styling
entries.description: `routes/workspace-picker.css` neutralises the dropdown accent palette, constrains the menu height and formats create-workspace forms to match the admin header tone.

entries.name: User menu theming
entries.description: `routes/user-menu.css` ensures the header dropdown inherits muted trigger text, stretches embedded forms and renders destructive items in the danger palette.

entries.name: Landing page palette
entries.description: `routes/index.css` introduces the marketing color variables, growth stats layout, selection styling and autofill tweaks used by the `data-page="opencode"` hero page.

entries.name: Zen marketing shell styles
entries.description: `routes/zen/index.css` sets Zen's palette, sticky top navigation, mobile menu toggles and autofill handling so the Zen landing mirrors the console brand system.

entries.name: Not-found page styling
entries.description: `routes/[...404].css` builds the 404 layout with dark/light logo swapping, dual CTA columns and responsive padding driven by `data-slot` attributes.

entries.name: Console app stylesheet entry
entries.description: `packages/console/app/src/app.css` imports the consolidated `style/index.css`, wiring Solid Start to bundle the design system tokens and component primitives for every console route.

entries.name: Console style aggregator
entries.description: `style/index.css` composes token layers (color/font/space), button primitives and base resets so the app shell loads one canonical stylesheet regardless of which component imports it.

entries.name: Button primitive styles
entries.description: `style/component/button.css` defines the `data-component="button"` contract, mapping color variants and size tokens to CSS vars so Solid components inherit hover/focus states from the design system.

entries.name: Modal overlay styling
entries.description: `component/modal.css` provides overlay/backdrop animations and light/dark adjustments for modal dialogs via `data-component="modal"`, standardising sheet spacing across workspace flows.

entries.name: Dropdown trigger styling
entries.description: `component/dropdown.css` styles the shared dropdown trigger/content slots, handling alignments and dark-mode shadows so workspace pickers and menus share consistent affordances.

entries.name: Console theme schema
entries.description: `packages/console/app/public/theme.json` documents the JSON schema for console themes, enumerating token slots such as diff colors and markdown accents so uploaded palettes validate against the same structure as TUI themes.

entries.name: Workspace invite email template
