entries.description: `emails/templates/InviteEmail.tsx` composes the workspace invite with branded logos, CTA button and fallback link, using the shared `Fonts` component to embed asset-hosted JetBrains Mono and Rubik files.

entries.name: Email component wrappers
entries.description: `emails/components.tsx` wraps `@jsx-email` primitives to merge shared typography, registers hosted fonts and provides helpers like `SplitString` so transactional templates keep consistent styling.

entries.name: Email style tokens
entries.description: `emails/styles.ts` exports the invite color palette, spacing unit and text presets (body, heading, link, button) to keep JSX emails consistent without inline duplication.

entries.name: Email asset passthrough
entries.description: `public/email` points SolidStart's public directory at `mail/emails/templates/static`, ensuring fonts and imagery are served verbatim for transactional emails.

entries.name: Embedded email font bundle
entries.description: JetBrains Mono, IBM Plex Mono and Rubik `.woff2` files under `templates/static` ship with the invite template so the `Fonts` component renders branded typography in clients.

entries.name: Email logo assets
entries.description: `logo.png`, `zen-logo.png` and `right-arrow.png` give invite emails retina-friendly branding and CTA arrows aligned with console dark/light variants.

entries.name: Social preview imagery
entries.description: `social-share.png` and `social-share-zen.png` provide opengraph hero shots for the console and Zen landers so shared links display branded previews.

entries.name: Console favicon variants
entries.description: `favicon.svg` and `favicon-zen.svg` ship mark variants so the marketing, admin and Zen shells can advertise the correct icon in browsers and link embeds.

entries.name: Robots policy for share links
entries.description: `public/robots.txt` allows the marketing site but blocks `/s/` slugged share pages from indexing so private session links stay off search engines.

entries.name: Share session viewer shell
entries.description: `components/Share.tsx` maintains WebSocket reconnection, reconciles session info/messages into a Solid store, tracks scroll anchors and exposes status cues so shared sessions stream live updates in the browser.

entries.name: Session part renderer
entries.description: `components/share/part.tsx` selects provider/tool icons, generates anchor links with clipboard feedback, renders markdown/code/error payloads and shows timing metadata for each message part in shared sessions.

entries.name: Share viewer helpers
entries.description: `components/share/common.tsx` supplies reusable pieces--`AnchorIcon` for copyable links, `createOverflow` resize observer and `formatDuration`used by every content renderer in the share UI.

entries.name: Code block highlighter
entries.description: `components/share/content-code.tsx` uses `shiki` with diff transformers to render assistant code blocks in light/dark themes, suspending until highlighting completes without blocking the page.

entries.name: Diff viewer
entries.description: `components/share/content-diff.tsx` parses unified patches with `parsePatch`, pairs removals/additions and renders side-by-side `ContentCode` panels plus mobile-friendly grouped blocks for share replays.

entries.name: Error panel toggler
entries.description: `components/share/content-error.tsx` combines `createOverflow` with an expand toggle so oversized tool errors collapse by default but remain copyable in the share UI.

entries.name: Text block renderer
entries.description: `components/share/content-text.tsx` renders user prompts in a `<pre>`, detects overflow, offers expand/collapse controls and attaches `CopyButton` for quick reuse.

entries.name: Terminal transcript renderer
entries.description: `components/share/content-bash.tsx` converts recorded command/output pairs to themed HTML with `shiki`, tracking overflow and exposing expand buttons for long logs.

entries.name: Copy button control
entries.description: `components/share/copy-button.tsx` centralises clipboard writes with a `copied` state and icon swap (clipboard/check), reused by text and markdown renderers.

entries.name: Markdown renderer
entries.description: `components/share/content-markdown.tsx` runs `marked` with `shiki` diff highlighting, trims wrapped fragments and reuses `CopyButton` with overflow controls for assistant responses.

entries.name: Docs collection loader
entries.description: `content.config.ts` registers the `docs` collection with `@astrojs/starlight` loaders and schema so the share site autoloads MDX content without custom plumbing.

entries.name: Intro guide content
entries.description: `docs/index.mdx` walks through install options across package managers, provider setup and first-run tips with interactive tabs and CLI snippets.

entries.name: Agents documentation page
entries.description: `docs/agents.mdx` explains primary vs subagents, @ mentions, navigation keybinds and JSON/Markdown configuration examples for custom assistants.

entries.name: CLI command reference
entries.description: `docs/cli.mdx` catalogs `opencode` commands such as `agent`, `auth` and `github`, outlining subcommands and usage for automation workflows.

entries.name: Configuration reference
entries.description: `docs/config.mdx` details config precedence, JSON/JSONC schema support and sections for TUI, tools, models and agents with inline examples.

entries.name: Plugin development guide
entries.description: `docs/plugins.mdx` covers plugin discovery paths, hook signatures and examples for notifications, env protection and custom tool registration.

entries.name: Provider configuration guide
entries.description: `docs/providers.mdx` describes provider setup, credential storage and model directory usage so users can connect OpenCode to external APIs.

entries.name: Tools documentation
entries.description: `docs/tools.mdx` explains built-in tools, permission flags and how to register custom MCP tools through config or plugins.

entries.name: Keybind customization guide
entries.description: `docs/keybinds.mdx` lists default bindings, leader key usage and config snippets for remapping or disabling shortcuts.

entries.name: Troubleshooting handbook
entries.description: `docs/troubleshooting.mdx` outlines log directories, storage layout, GitHub/Discord support channels and fixes for common startup and auth errors.

entries.name: Zen provider overview
entries.description: `docs/zen.mdx` introduces OpenCode Zen, explains onboarding, endpoints, model IDs and pricing so teams can rely on curated provider defaults.

entries.name: Share viewer route
entries.description: `pages/s/[id].astro` fetches share metadata from the Worker API, builds OG cards with model/version badges and hydrates the Solid `Share` component client-side while disabling indexing for private sessions.

entries.name: Lang-map ambient types
entries.description: `projects/OpenCode/packages/web/src/types/lang-map.d.ts` provides the module declaration for `lang-map`, exposing `map.extensions/languages` so the share viewer can resolve syntax highlighting metadata with TypeScript safety.

entries.name: Plugin hooks contract
entries.description: `packages/plugin/src/index.ts` defines the `Plugin` signature, `PluginInput` context and the `Hooks` map (events, config, tool, auth) so third-party packages can extend opencode runtimes safely.

entries.name: Bun shell interface
entries.description: `packages/plugin/src/shell.ts` specifies the `BunShell` template literal callable, chaining helpers (cwd/env/nothrow) and typed output readers so plugins can execute bun `$` commands ergonomically.

entries.name: Tool builder helper
entries.description: `packages/plugin/src/tool.ts` exposes `tool({ description, args, execute })` backed by `zod`, re-exporting `tool.schema` so plugin authors can declare typed tool handlers tied to session context.

entries.name: Example plugin skeleton
entries.description: `packages/plugin/src/example.ts` demonstrates registering a `tool`, tweaking `chat.params` and returning empty permission hooks, providing a starting template for integrators.

entries.name: Plugin publish manifest rewrite
entries.description: `packages/plugin/script/publish.ts` recompiles TypeScript, rewrites `package.json` exports to the dist folder, publishes with optional snapshot tag and restores the original manifest.

entries.name: Reusable Bun setup action
entries.description: `.github/actions/setup-bun/action.yml` wraps `oven-sh/setup-bun@v2`, caches `~/.bun` and runs `bun install`, providing a composite action that every workflow reuses to get the workspace ready without duplicating cache plumbing.

entries.name: Deploy SST environments
entries.description: `deploy.yml` runs on pushes to `dev`/`production`, reuses the Bun setup action and runs `bun sst deploy --stage=$ref_name`, wiring Cloudflare, Planetscale and Stripe secrets so each branch promotes the matching SST stage.

entries.name: Duplicate issue triage
entries.description: `duplicate-issues.yml` invokes the opencode CLI via Anthropic when a ticket opens, scanning existing issues with `gh` commands and commenting potential duplicates under a locked permission manifest so maintainers get AI triage without broadened shell access.

entries.name: Auto-format fixer
entries.description: `format.yml` checks out the repo, runs the shared Bun setup and executes `./script/format.ts`, committing changes back to origin so Prettier drift is corrected automatically on PRs and pushes.

entries.name: PR guidelines review
entries.description: `guidelines-check.yml` (currently commented out) installs opencode on `pull_request_target` and has Claude audit diffs against `AGENTS.md`, posting review comments through `gh api` when violations appear.

entries.name: Release Discord notifier
entries.description: `notify-discord.yml` fires on published releases and uses `SethCohen/github-releases-to-discord@v1` to push a formatted embed to the community webhook, keeping Discord in sync with GitHub tags.

entries.name: Issue comment agent runner
entries.description: `opencode.yml` listens for `/oc` commands, checks out the repo and runs `sst/opencode/github@latest` with the hosted API key so maintainers can spin up AI sessions from GitHub threads via comments.

entries.name: GitHub Action publisher
entries.description: `publish-github-action.yml` triggers on `github-v*` tags, fetches full history and runs `github/script/publish` with bot credentials to retag `latest` and push marketplace updates for the action bundle.

entries.name: VS Code extension release
entries.description: `publish-vscode.yml` publishes the VS Code extension on `vscode-v*` tags, sharing the Bun setup, installing `vsce`, then invoking `sdks/vscode/script/publish` with VSCE and OpenVSX tokens.

entries.name: Manual release orchestrator
entries.description: `publish.yml` accepts a bump input, primes Go and Bun toolchains, installs `pacman-package-manager` for AUR pushes and runs `./script/publish.ts` with credentials for npm, GitHub, AUR and OpenCode API to drive the multi-channel release.

entries.name: Snapshot channel publisher
entries.description: `snapshot.yml` watches `dev` and `opentui`, fetches tags, prepares Go and Bun and reuses `script/publish.ts` with snapshot credentials so nightly builds refresh npm and GitHub artifacts without bump prompts.

entries.name: Daily stats collector
entries.description: `stats.yml` runs nightly cron, primes Bun, executes `bun script/stats.ts`, commits the updated `STATS.md` and pushes with PostHog credentials to keep adoption metrics fresh.

entries.name: Turbo test matrix
entries.description: `test.yml` runs on pushes and PRs, installs Bun via the composite action and runs `bun turbo typecheck` plus `bun turbo test`, ensuring type safety and unit suites gate merges.

entries.name: PR typecheck gate
entries.description: `typecheck.yml` focuses on pull requests to `dev`, running the shared Bun bootstrap and `bun typecheck` so lightweight PRs still get static checks without the full Turbo graph.

entries.name: Go SDK lint & test workflow
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/.github/workflows/ci.yml` runs lint and test jobs on push/PR, using the Stainless bootstrap scripts on Depot runners for the upstream `sst/opencode-sdk-go` repository.

entries.name: TUI GoReleaser targets
entries.description: `packages/tui/.goreleaser.yml` publishes the Go TUI binary for linux/darwin amd64/arm64, wires Homebrew, AUR and nfpm packages, and stamps builds with `internal/version.Version` for release automation.

entries.name: Brand & GitHub palettes
entries.description: `opencode.json` pairs the brand cyan/orange accents with dark/light splits, while `github.json` mirrors GitHub's syntax colors so the TUI can ship with both house style and familiar GitHub contrast presets.

entries.name: Pastel IDE classics
entries.description: `ayu.json` and `palenight.json` translate popular VS Code palettes into the TUI schema, providing high-contrast blues and violets with matching ANSI fallbacks for code panes.

entries.name: Calm pastel themes
entries.description: `catppuccin.json` and `rosepine.json` supply desaturated lavender/mauve palettes with matching light/dark variants, giving the terminal softer gradients tailored to long sessions.

entries.name: Japanese night palettes
entries.description: `tokyonight.json` and `kanagawa.json` bring deep navy backgrounds with teal/magenta highlights, matching popular Neovim themes so opencode mirrors those workflows out of the box.

entries.name: Cobalt & One Dark
entries.description: `cobalt2.json` delivers bright cyan/yellow terminals, while `one-dark.json` captures Atom's muted teal/orange mix, both tuned for high readability in dim environments.

entries.name: Dracula & Monokai
entries.description: `dracula.json` and `monokai.json` capture the iconic purple/pink and lime/orange fonts, ensuring the TUI mimics long-standing code editor defaults when agents share sessions.

entries.name: Earthy contrast themes
entries.description: `everforest.json` and `gruvbox.json` ship warm browns and moss greens with ANSI fallbacks, matching the low-saturation palettes often used for late-night terminals.

entries.name: Nord & Solarized
entries.description: `nord.json` and `solarized.json` port well-known accessibility palettes with balanced contrast, giving the TUI preset options optimised for eye strain.

entries.name: Material & Zenburn
entries.description: `material.json` pairs teal accents with deep gray backdrops, while `zenburn.json` keeps low-contrast olive tones, covering both modern and legacy Vim palettes.

entries.name: Neon specialty themes
entries.description: `matrix.json` offers high-contrast green-on-black terminal colours, while `synthwave84.json` introduces neon magenta and cyan for stylistic demos and screenshots.

entries.name: Dark neon blends
entries.description: `aura.json` and `vesper.json` provide deep purple bases with saturated highlights, offering moody alternatives for operators who prefer darker neon palettes.

entries.name: Starlight override tokens
entries.description: `styles/custom.css` overrides Starlight variables, defines light/dark color tokens and tweaks navigation chrome so the documentation shell matches the share viewer branding.

entries.name: Share page layout
entries.description: `components/share.module.css` lays out the share header, stats chips and part list widths, exposing CSS variables like `--term-icon` so the viewer renders conversation timelines responsively.

entries.name: Copy button hover affordance
entries.description: `copy-button.module.css` renders copy icons invisibly until parent hover, flipping colour to green when `data-copied` is set so viewers get subtle copy feedback across card types.

entries.name: Text snippet styling
entries.description: `content-text.module.css` styles natural language blocks with expand/collapse behaviour, theme variants and copy button placement, ensuring instructions render compactly on mobile.

entries.name: Terminal transcript styling
entries.description: `content-bash.module.css` builds the fake terminal chrome, header icon mask and expandable output clamp so shell commands display with scroll limits yet reveal full logs on demand.

entries.name: Conversation part layout
entries.description: `part.module.css` aligns anchors, reasoning blocks and assistant text, handling copied-state tooltips and spacing so each share part renders with timeline rails.

entries.name: Diff viewer styling
entries.description: `content-diff.module.css` switches between desktop split and mobile stacked diff layouts, reusing red/green token vars and symbol pseudo-elements to mark added/removed lines.

entries.name: Code block styling
entries.description: `content-code.module.css` wraps shiki-rendered code with border treatments and a `data-flush` mode so snippets can either float with cards or blend inline with markdown sections.

entries.name: Markdown renderer styling
entries.description: `content-markdown.module.css` clamps markdown previews, normalises list/table spacing and injects code fences so markdown answers stay legible while still supporting expand/collapse.

entries.name: Error message styling
entries.description: `content-error.module.css` styles agent error logs with color-coded spans and clamp controls so multi-line stderr output stays readable yet collapsible in shared sessions.

entries.name: Config loader coverage
entries.description: `config/config.test.ts` exercises JSON/JSONC precedence, env/file substitutions and schema validation to ensure the opencode config cascade behaves identically in tests and CLI.

entries.name: Markdown path extractor tests
entries.description: `config/markdown.test.ts` verifies the regex that extracts `@path` references skips emails/backticks and supports absolute, hidden and tilde-prefixed paths used in prompts.

entries.name: File ignore rules test
entries.description: `file/ignore.test.ts` guards the `FileIgnore` matcher so nested and trailing `node_modules` patterns are consistently filtered when agents propose edits.

entries.name: Patch parser regression suite
entries.description: `patch/patch.test.ts` stress tests `Patch.parsePatch` for add/delete/update/move cases, heredoc detection and invalid input handling to keep apply_patch ergonomics stable.

entries.name: Patch tool execution tests
entries.description: `tool/patch.test.ts` covers the Patch tool command guardrails: parameter validation, workspace path checks, multi-file patches and diff metadata generation.

entries.name: Bash tool safeguards
entries.description: `tool/bash.test.ts` ensures the Bash tool executes within the project, rejects upward `cd` attempts and returns captured output metadata for automation consumers.

entries.name: Snapshot revert coverage
entries.description: `snapshot/snapshot.test.ts` bootstraps git repos to prove `Snapshot.track/patch/revert` handle deletes, large files, symlinks and deep directories before agents call them.

entries.name: Test harness utilities
entries.description: `test/preload.ts`, `test/fixture/fixture.ts` and `test/bun.test.ts` disable noisy logging, provide disposable git-aware temp dirs and assert Bun CLI code avoids hardcoded registries, keeping the test runner stable.

entries.name: Input driver benchmark coverage
entries.description: `packages/tui/input/driver_test.go` benchmarks `NewReader.ReadEvents` against a stream of escape sequences (shift+tab, OSC color reports, modifyOtherKeys) to ensure the driver parses composite input without allocations or EOF churn.

entries.name: Windows input translation tests
entries.description: `packages/tui/input/driver_windows_test.go` feeds synthetic Win32 `InputRecord`s into `parseWin32InputKeyEvent`/`parseConInputEvent`, asserting modifier handling, UTF-16 surrogate decoding, background color OSC responses and mouse/focus/window events match the portable `Event` types.

entries.name: Focus/blur escape handling
entries.description: `packages/tui/input/focus_test.go` verifies that `Parser.parseSequence` recognises `ESC[I`/`ESC[O` as `FocusEvent`/`BlurEvent`, ensuring terminals that emit Xterm focus notifications translate to model focus changes.

entries.name: Key sequence parsing regression suite
entries.description: `packages/tui/input/key_test.go` exhaustively enumerates CSI/SS3 sequences, kitty graphics payloads, modifyOtherKeys reports and background color OSC messages, asserting they normalise into `Event`s (including cursor-position fallbacks) and benchmarking `parseSequence` throughput.

entries.name: Mouse protocol decoding tests
entries.description: `packages/tui/input/mouse_test.go` covers X10, SGR and modifier combinations, ensuring mouse clicks, motion, wheel, and drag sequences stringify correctly and map to `Mouse*Event` variants across modifiers and coordinate extremes.

entries.name: Sequence parsing smoke tests
entries.description: `packages/tui/input/parse_test.go` feeds a mixed byte stream (alt+tab, OSC 10 colors, modifyOtherKeys, xterm mode reports) through `Parser.parseSequence`, verifying event order plus a benchmark to protect parser allocations.

entries.name: Model lookup helpers
entries.description: `packages/tui/internal/app/app_test.go` unit tests `findModelByFullID`, `findModelByProviderAndModelID` and `findProviderByID`, confirming the TUI resolves provider/model pairs and gracefully handles missing entries before mutating session state.

entries.name: Parallel string writer determinism
entries.description: `packages/tui/internal/util/concurrency_test.go` asserts `util.WriteStringsPar` steadies output ordering even when goroutines finish out-of-order, using inverse sleep delays to stress the concurrent writer that formats lists in the TUI.

entries.name: Status watcher git probes
entries.description: `packages/tui/internal/components/status/status_test.go` fabricates `.git` layouts to validate `getGitRefFile`, HEAD hash fallbacks and the file watcher smoke test, ensuring the status bar can read branches without panicking outside repos.

entries.name: Attachment text fallback
entries.description: `packages/tui/internal/components/textarea/textarea_test.go` exercises `removeAttachmentAtCursor`, verifying attachments convert into `@file` tokens regardless of cursor position, protecting undo/redo and keyboard deletion paths.

entries.name: List navigation key map tests
entries.description: `packages/tui/internal/components/list/list_test.go` covers arrow, vim (`j/k`), ctrl shortcuts, wrap-around and empty states for the generic list component, ensuring selection handling remains predictable when rendered in Bubble Tea.

entries.name: Theme loader override checks
entries.description: `packages/tui/internal/theme/loader_test.go` validates `LoadThemesFromJSON` and `LoadThemesFromDirectories`, confirming bundled presets exist and directory precedence (cwd  project  user) overrides theme palettes correctly.

entries.name: App service Prism smoke tests
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/app_test.go` (Stainless-generated) invokes `client.App.Log` and `.Providers` with optional parameters against the Prism mock, illustrating how to seed context, base URLs and dumping request payloads when errors surface.

entries.name: Agent listing Prism test
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/agent_test.go` exercises `client.Agent.List` with directory overrides, ensuring the Go SDK optional params compile and the generated error unwrapping logs Prism failures for agent catalogs.

entries.name: Command catalog Prism test
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/command_test.go` hits `client.Command.List` with optional directory input, providing a template for invoking command metadata from Go integrations when Prism or real endpoints are available.

entries.name: Config fetch Prism test
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/config_test.go` demonstrates fetching `.Config.Get` with directory overrides, reinforcing how generated params map to Go structs when hydrating workspace configuration via the SDK.

entries.name: Path resolver Prism test
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/path_test.go` calls `client.Path.Get`, showing how repo-relative directory overrides propagate through Stainless clients when enumerating path metadata.

entries.name: Project listing Prism tests
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/project_test.go` validates both `Project.List` and `Project.Current`, demonstrating how to scope workspace discovery via optional directory arguments in generated Go clients.

entries.name: Find service Prism suite
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/find_test.go` issues `Find.Files`, `.Symbols` and `.Text` calls with query/pattern fields, documenting how text, file and symbol search parameters map into Go structs.

entries.name: File service Prism suite
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/file_test.go` covers `File.List`, `.Read` and `.Status`, providing ready-made examples for streaming file metadata with optional `Directory` and `Path` parameters.

entries.name: Session lifecycle Prism suite
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/session_test.go` exercises the generated `Session` client across create, update, list, delete, abort, children and command endpoints, showing how optional IDs and directory overrides are populated in Go integrations.

entries.name: Session permission Prism test
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/sessionpermission_test.go` confirms `Session.Permissions.Respond` serialises enum responses and workspace overrides correctly, guiding automation that approves tool prompts from Go.

entries.name: TUI control Prism suite
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/tui_test.go` exercises every `/tui/*` endpoint (append/clear prompt, execute command, open help/models/sessions), documenting how to drive the terminal UI remotely with generated clients.

entries.name: Usage reporting sample
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/usage_test.go` bootstraps the client against Prism and performs `Session.List`, offering a minimal example for capturing usage data and logging results from Go.

entries.name: Go SDK client transport tests
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/client_test.go` checks User-Agent headers, retry/backoff headers, header overrides, context cancellation and SSE deadline handling, documenting transport behaviours underpinning all generated services.

entries.name: Event stream Prism test
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/client_test.go` stream helpers demonstrate consuming `Event.ListStreaming` with context deadlines and request timeouts, covering SSE cancellation semantics for long-lived subscriptions.

entries.name: Query encoder coverage
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/internal/apiquery/query_test.go` enumerates primitives, pointer slices, unions and deeply nested structs to ensure the Stainless query encoder matches expected URL encoding across date formats and inline extras.

entries.name: Multipart form encoder tests
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/internal/apiform/form_test.go` verifies multipart request encoding for files, optional fields and metadata, guarding the form builder used by upload endpoints.

entries.name: API JSON decoder regression suite
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/internal/apijson/json_test.go` stresses the generated JSON decoder with pointers, inline metadata, union discriminators and recursive structs, validating Stainless runtime behaviour for complex payloads.

entries.name: Field metadata helpers tests
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/internal/apijson/field_test.go` ensures field metadata captures presence, nullability and extras, keeping the generated typed accessors in sync with the raw JSON representation.

entries.name: Port validation tests
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/internal/apijson/port_test.go` validates the port parsing helpers that convert string-or-number inputs into ints with range checks, guarding generated client validation.

entries.name: Struct tag parser helpers
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/internal/apijson/tag.go` parses `json` and `format` struct tags into Stainless metadata (`required`, `extras`, `inline`), underpinning the runtime reflection used by the generated decoder.

entries.name: JS client default config
entries.description: `packages/sdk/js/src/gen/client.gen.ts` exposes `createClient` and `createClientConfig`, wiring the generated client with a default `http://localhost:4096` base URL and typed config factory for custom transports.

entries.name: JS client barrel exports
entries.description: `packages/sdk/js/src/gen/client/index.ts` re-exports auth helpers, body serializers, config builders and typed client interfaces, forming the top-level entry for external consumers of the generated SDK.

entries.name: JS client option types
entries.description: `packages/sdk/js/src/gen/client/types.gen.ts` defines `ClientOptions`, `RequestOptions`, response style unions and SSE typings, describing how interceptors and auth metadata plug into the generated fetch client.

entries.name: JS client utility pipeline
entries.description: `packages/sdk/js/src/gen/client/utils.gen.ts` supplies interceptor composition, config merging and header helpers used by every request, showing where to hook custom middleware into the JS SDK.

entries.name: JS auth schema helpers
entries.description: `packages/sdk/js/src/gen/core/auth.gen.ts` enumerates Stainless auth schemes and resolves security handlers, mapping OpenAPI security requirements into runtime fetch headers.

entries.name: JS body serializer strategies
entries.description: `packages/sdk/js/src/gen/core/bodySerializer.gen.ts` wires JSON, URL search params and FormData serializers plus query builder options, powering how the generated client marshals request bodies.

entries.name: JS path serializer helpers
entries.description: `packages/sdk/js/src/gen/core/pathSerializer.gen.ts` implements templated path substitution and array encoding for URL segments, preventing malformed routes in generated SDK calls.

entries.name: JS core transport types
entries.description: `packages/sdk/js/src/gen/core/types.gen.ts` defines low-level request/response contracts, middleware interfaces and streaming options shared by all generated clients.

entries.name: JS SDK service barrel
entries.description: `packages/sdk/js/src/gen/sdk.gen.ts` aggregates service-specific builders (`session`, `project`, `tui`, etc.), exposing the typed client surface that `createOpencode` re-exports.

entries.name: JS API type definitions
entries.description: `packages/sdk/js/src/gen/types.gen.ts` contains the generated request/response type map, including enums and shared schemas, ensuring TypeScript consumers get end-to-end typing for Opencode endpoints.

entries.name: Stainless stats metadata
entries.description: `packages/sdk/go/.stats.yml` records the OpenAPI spec hash, configured endpoint count and generator config hash, helping verify when go-sdk regeneration diverges from server contracts.

entries.name: Stainless multi-target config
entries.description: `packages/sdk/stainless/stainless.yml` defines how TypeScript, Go and Python SDKs are produced (package names, repos, streaming strategies, resources), serving as the single source for SDK regeneration.
